description:
I have to say, it was great. I see a lot of reviews complaining about the service time, and yes, it was not super fast.  But knowing that going in, we had a great time. To start, The fresh baked bread and pesto oil sauce was awesome. The pear spinach salad was fresh and flavorful. The seafood pasta was rich and creamy. I'd order it all again. Bring your own wine on a Wednesday (be sure to get a starter and main each for the deal) and enjoy no corkage fee. 

If you come in for an enjoyable meal at an easy pace, you'll have a wonderful time. If you're in a rush, go somewhere else. 

We'll be back to this neighborhood gem for sure.
author: Hayley Y.

description:
TWO AND A HALF HOURS. 
That's how long my friend and I were stuck in this restaurant because of painfully slow service. I'm an antsy person. This was far from ideal. 

Quick rant: It took one hour for bread to come out after asking multiple times. Note that it takes an hour to fly to Vegas from SF, and they couldn't cut 3 measly pieces of bread in this time. We received no refills on water until the very end of our meal, after asking multiple times. It took two hours for our main dish to come out. Some people are able to run an entire marathon in the time it took this salmon to come out. It took 30 minutes just to pay the bill...okay, really? That's the easy part!

The waitress saw that we were annoyed and gave us free dessert, which would have been great except for the fact that we already had free dessert coupons. She didn't make us use the coupons so that we could have dessert again next time. I thought this was a pretty cheesy way of dealing with really grumpy customers who just spent HOURS waiting for food. She also gave us a free pour of really terrible tasting wine (Super metallic. I had one sip and couldn't drink it), but at least she tried? NOTE: The waitress was really nice, and this was not fully her fault. The restaurant was SEVERELY understaffed and she was basically the only one waiting all the tables. 

The crazy part is that I might even give this place a second try. Every dish that *eventually* came out was delicious. The salmon was huge and well-seasoned, the rice was cooked nicely, the vegetables were flavorful and soft. Our wine (not the free pour) was decent, the Celery Potato soup was really flavorful, and the pesto & olive oil dip that came with the bread was tasty. As for dessert, the tiramisu was a massive, creamy piece of deliciousness. The cream puffs were pretty dang good too. 

If the service wasn't so damn slow, this would have easily been a 4 or 5 star review.
author: Heather R.

description:
4 for the service, 3 for the food, which me and my friend were unimpressed with. 

The prix-fixe lured us in. 3 courses for $17?! What a steal!! To be fair, I was very underwhelmed with the first two courses: a spinach potato soup and their "special of the day" (okay I was willing to accept sub-par fish because of this special)... but the dessert - the ile flottant - was actually quite marvelous! It was light and airy - not too sweet - but altogether, the food didn't strike me as extraordinary. 

I just wouldn't come out of my way to eat here again.
author: Cindy W.

description:
We were staying at the B&B across the street and decided to eat here for our last meal in SF before flying out early the next morning. Fussy wife and two daughters were super hungry. We read a few reviews that squawked about really slow service, but we decided to take our chances even with three starving girls. As soon as we walked in, we were seated and served water and warm sourdough bread with a pesto dipping oil. The girls ravaged through all of the bread in like 3 minutes. 

More warm bread was brought to our table before we even decided what to order. 

The folks next to us were regulars, and this was their local neighborhood restaurant.

Anyhow, do yourself a favor and have a meal. There were only 2 wait staff the night we went, but the kitchen pumped out the orders in record time. The girls ended up eating 4 baskets of sourdough! So embarrassing... Thumbs up!! :-)
author: Barry L.

description: I now see why this quint little cafe is a neighborhood fav! Despite living around the corner I only ate here a couple of weeks ago and the food and service were incredible. The fish was super fresh and the sides and sauces were yummy to say the least. I got the blackened shrimp risotto and it was soooo good. Huge shrimp and flavorful risotto! They also had a good wine selection and the owner attended to us himself and was very warm, funny and knowledgeable. I'll most certainty keep coming back here!
author: Sam M.

description:
Ok I kind of don't want to write this in the fear that the more people that leave great reviews will change the service or currently non existent wait time... But it's too good not to review!!!!

Came in with my girlfriends for dinner and was so happy we did. Best decision we made all evening lol.

Service is amazing. Suzie was so nice and gave great recommendations and we all mentioned you just never get service that good in the Bay area... Especially at a restaurant that doesn't have $$$$ price tag. 

Food. Let's talk gang cuz this place is legit. Mussels appetizer with fries. Good sized, perfectly cooked, broth is amazing... I'll come back just for that!

Ordered the blackened salmon with the parsley garlic butter and double veggies... Yeah it was as good as it sounds. Perfectly cooked. Tons of amazing flavors...

Free dessert with Yelp check in. You can choose the dessert you want from the full list vs just the generic cheapest option. We got the creme brulee... Hot damn I wasn't hungry but geebus that was good. 

Overall, so glad it's so close to my place, great prices, great service, great food,... Just a lot of greats.
author: Mandi W.

description:
This spot has still got it! Have come here off and on over the years...not bc it's bad, but bc it's a bit out of my usual dining out neighborhoods. 

Let's just start with service. Susie (sp?) is the best! If I could give ten stars for service alone, I would! She moves from table to table, being equally attentive and efficient. We were mesmerized by her genuine friendliness...honestly, top notch. 

Food was perfection. And for the price they charge?! Nothing short of amazing. Their pre fixe menu is $16.50 for a three-course! In SF, that's outrageously cheap. So kudos to them for keeping their prices wallet-friendly over the yrs. The buds and I started with the mussels and fries. OMG, get this. The mussels were plump and the fries were perfectly crispy. For entrees, we tried the blackened shrimp risotto, blackened salmon with parsley butter, and the grilled sole with tomato sauce. We also went double veggies on the fish dishes. I'm not crazy about cooked carrots and sautéed zucchini's, but that's a personal preference. Otherwise, all of the seafood dishes hit the spot! 

In the end, Susie didn't even ask us to check-in for the free dessert (even though we did) - a quick wink and a "I gotchu" was all it took. Ended with the creme brûlée and, yes, it was delish as well. 

Will I be back? Hell yes. Easily 5 stars :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Super quaint being the only restaurant in the area. 
Food is good,  making this a neighborhood gem, they've been at this spot for a while thanks to a solid following.
author: E U.

description:
Love their Tuesday evening half price glasses of wine. A quaint and hidden gem in a residential neighborhood. Friendly staff and a variety of different enjoyed to choose from. I love that they have vegan choices. 
 Will need to come again!
author: V. P.

description: Jacquie was the best waitress ever, and her assistant was delightful as well! And the food was delicious too. Perfectly cooked scallops, delectible escargot, amazing risotto and champagne, somehow the bill was under $100! I would go here every week if I could.
author: Zoe T.

description: Let's cut to the chase. The atmosphere was great but the food was to be desired. My fish was quite dry and too salty. Dinner companion ordered the steak with "pommes frites." What arrived were curly-Q seasoned fries next to a steak. What a let down. Expected a lot more.
author: Greg A.

description:
Everything started off so positive here and then quickly went downhill. 

My boyfriend and I came here for our 3 year anniversary dinner which happened to be on a Wednesday and chose this place because of their no corkage fee. Yay always a great deal! Wrong. 

But we'll start off with the good. We were seated in this cute corner with lots of pillows and windows, making it feel more private and secluded a bit from the other tables. The service was better than expected (from the reviews I read) however I did have to ask for menus. They poured our BYO wine right away. We weren't sure what we wanted so the man who seemed to be either the owner or lead waiter made suggestions. We both got blackened salmon, mine with the parsley garlic butter and his with the green peppercorn sauce. 

The food was great, took no time at all to come out and was delicious. Was the perfect size (not too big or small) for the price it was. Oh and the pesto and bread it the beginning was amazing. Honestly probably my favorite part. 

The meal came to a close and I inquired about the free dessert check in on Yelp but the man said you can't combine offers (free dessert + free corkage = no no). I thought that was fair and said no worries. 

Then the check came and there's a $20 corkage fee. I asked the lady now helping us and she said you have to buy two entrees PER PERSON. I reread the menu now realizing what it said though not terribly clear. Also how is that any sort of a deal and regardless, $20 corkage fee?!? If that's the going rate for twisting open a bottle then hot damn I need to revisit my career choices. 

My boyfriend who is much more grounded than I in these situations said not to worry about, we misunderstood, etc. but to me this guy who had been serving us the entire time had to of known we weren't "following the rules" of the corkage fee and could have said something and/or could have given us the check in offer. 

And for that I was irritated and do not like the way business is being run here.
author: Kelly G.

description:
This is a super classy local neighborhood restaurant. They serve a variety of dishes, but specialize in seafood. There are always many selections of daily specials on the menu, all with fresh ingredients made into a unique dish. I've never had anything I didn't like here, and this is the first place I ever tried escargot! They always cook their dishes to perfection, as well, whether it be steak, seafood, etc. 
The seating isn't the most comfortable (wooden booths with pillows on them), but the ambiance is quaint and classy and it makes up for it. I've always had excellent service as well, with knowledgeable staff that can provide personalized recommendations based on your preferences.
author: Traci A.

description: Excellent service, French food, and reasonable prices. My new favorite restaurant in SF. I'm a sucker for Escargots, fresh fish, and no corkage fee Wednesdays. I only wish I had discovered this hidden gem earlier.
author: Eloy T.

description:
Alamo Square Seafood Grill is a GREAT date-night destination, except for the usual area parking woes :-)

Wonderfully decorated hole-in-the-wall, reminded me of nothing more than restaurants near the Eiffel Tower, happy people seated at small tables dining on great-smelling dishes.

Steamed chorizo mussels, escargot, fish (one with Béarnaise, one Provençal). All tasty. All cooked with just the right notes; nothing extraneous. I'll be coming back soon!
author: Michael S.

description:
Service was painful. ..long waits between all service. Foods was disappointing. 
Ordered: butternut squash soup (salty),
calamari (flavorless) auhi tuna (was fine)
Pouched salmon with wine & butter sauce (nothing special with fish...but sauce excellent)....

I'd pass on a repeat event
author: Sharine d.

description: I'm sad to write a negative update but think it's important to share. Came back with a friend visiting San Francisco. Only 1 server for the entire restuarant. Took over an hour to order. Ordered the mussels and instead of frites they came with seasoned, thick cut French fries. Ordered the same dish I had on my first visit and had half the amount of sides. Mussels were not fresh. It's important that the owners properly staff their restaurant. One server can not do an entire restaurant. Limited kitchen staff as well. I want to see this restaurant do well and that's why I'm sharing. Hope they can improve on this as it's a very relaxed and local spot.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Ok.  Let's get the negative out of the way.  Service.  Ridiculously slow.  Have some patience.  Let the food do the talking.  Try not to get upset that service is unfriendly and snail-like.  Sounds terrible cause service really initiates the standards at a restaurant but I feel like this place should be given another shot. 

The prix fixe menu is fantastic.  For $14.50, it's just ridiculous.  You start off with either soup or salad.  Pick an entree.  I ordered the trout that evening which was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  For dessert, they offered a meringue which was alright.  I think the star of the show was the entree.  Fresh, tasty, delicious.  

They also offer no corkage fees on Wednesdays but you can't order the prix fixe menu.  It's a small spot so you can smell everything that's going on in the kitchen.  

Get past the service and you'll love this place.  4 stars.
author: Jen W.

description: This place is wonderful. Great food, And the proprietor of the establishment was extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Jason B.

description:
I had high expectations for this restaurant, however, I could not have been more disappointed.
The service was a bit curt and rude.....my filet of Sole fish was overcooked, and when I mentioned it, I was told they would do it over....they did not take my plate away, but made me wait at least 15 min., after which they brought a second plate with only fish on it.
When we both asked for lemon slices, they brought one slice in a napkin.
For a seafood place, the fish did not seem fresh, and the crab cakes did not taste like lump crab.
This seems like a nice neighborhood restaurant, but there are only two servers who appeared rushed.
Perhaps this was just at an off night, but sadly, I will be back.
author: Sharon G.

description: If you are in a hurry not the place to go.  The food was excellent.  We had a large party and every dish was excellent.  Prices are reasonable and it's a decent location.
author: Gloria D.

description:
I wish I could give it 5 Stars, but the service.. the service was awful. The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered the blackened salmon, my mom ordered the grilled red snapper, and my boyfriend ordered the blackened red snapper. He was accidentally given the salmon instead, but luckily it was delicious so it didn't matter. Fish, veggies, and rice were all great. 

When it came to the service, we arrived when there was only one other person in the restaurant. You'd think that would mean we would get more than enough attention, but nope. We had to constantly flag down our waiter for a plate, utensils, water refills, bread, etc. We sat at our table for an absurdly long time before he even approached us about the menu. He constantly forgot our requests and we honestly felt like we were a burden to him. 

It makes me sad because the food really was delicious! But I'm not sure if I'd go back solely for the service.
author: Tiffany S.

description: We tried this restaurant based on a recommendation of a fellow traveler. It offers cozy comfortable seating. My husband had the salmon and I had the crab cake meal. Both were delicious! And we had the flourless chocolate cake for dessert. Perfect ending to the meal. Loved our waitress too. It was very reasonably priced for the quality. Would definitely recommend.
author: Eydie C.

description: The appetizer and soup were great, but the entree left more to be desired.  We had the shrimp and spinach risotto.  The spinach to rice ratio was off, so it seemed like I was eating shrimp and spinach with a bit of rice.
author: Rachel L.

description: Really enjoyed our meal here! We ordered a bottle of wine and various fish dishes. The bread and pesto was served to us immediately delicious! We were served complimentary frites as our meal was told to take 30 minutes to prepare. We would not have minded waiting that long regardless but thought it was excellent customer service. The restaurant is small and in a pretty quiet neighborhood but has a nice ambiance! We also checked in on Yelp and received a free dessert! I'm not sure exactly what it was, it was called "floating" something, but it was delicious!
author: Kelly F.

description:
I remember coming here about 20 years ago when they opened and when I lived in the neighborhood.  It used to be pretty good and reasonable, but things have changed.  The food was just OK.  The calamari was average but not very flavorful.  The fish was tasty, however, the bearnaise sauce I got with it was served in a ramekin and was the consistency of pudding, not a sauce, and was at room temperature.  Clearly this sauce was made earlier and left sitting where it congealed.  Scary part is we were the first customers in so I assume that sauce was leftover from the night before.  The rice and veggies that came with the fish were completely bland and I barely touched them.
  
My biggest gripe is the wine list.  The cheapest bottle of wine they have is $42!!  This is a hole in the wall neighborhood bistro/grill, not a high end restaurant like Bix or Boulevard that can get away with those prices.  It's just obnoxious and smacks of laziness on the owners part.  This is northern California for pity's sake and you're telling me you can't find a decent bottle of wine to serve to your clients under $42?  Most decent restaurants will have one or two bottles around $28 then a few in the $30's, but to have none is just plain ridiculous.   We did notice they advertise half prices on all bottles and glasses of wine on two nights during the week.  So basically you get priced gouged on wine unless you come on those days.  That's not how you get people to come back to your establishment.  

When I asked for salt I was brought a salt grinder that look like it came from the bargain bin at Safeway.  It was one of those cheap clear plastic grinders you can't re-fill with labels all over it.  So your cheapest bottle of wine is $42 but you can't afford a simple salt shaker for your clients?    

We were so ready to go and decided to get dessert at Gold Mirror with some reasonably priced port.  

As we were paying our waitress asks "Can I ask you a personal question?"  Not something I want to hear from anyone unless I know them well, but being polite we said sure.  

Then she asks "Am I fat?"

Apparently one of the cooks told her she looked fat.  We told her she wasn't and left.  

What a very bizarre meal.
author: Sean M.

description: I came here as a treat to myself for finishing unpacking my house finally. I ordered a glass of wine and the poached pear salad (great salad!), but then the main entree was extremely disappointing. The fish itself was OK but the mixed vegetables and rice had no flavor. I missed the prixe fixe and ended with a $50 tab, entirely too much for the food that was served. I do not recommend coming here, unfortunately, unless you can make it for the prixe fixe. A disappointment for my celebration dinner :/
author: Shelby B.

description: I love this place. It's a minute from my home and it provides a really consistent experience at a good price for this neighborhood. I always get the same thing so I can only recommend one thing here: the blackened salmon fish of the day.
author: Clara Y.

description: We are staying at the B&B across the street; after a long day, did not want to travel far for dinner. Food was excellent, especially the ceviche, fish was really fresh. It's a small place, seemingly filled with locals. Service wasn't super fast, but was not slow either. Perhaps it was because we were just so tired we were slightly more impatient to eat and leave. Prices extremely reasonable, definitely recommend and I would go back for the ceviche for sure.
author: JoAnn H.

description: Some of the best service and seafood in the area! Consistently good food, wine, and desserts.
author: Ariel B.

description: We came for dinner on a Friday night and I was pleasantly surprised that the was no wait. Bread and pesto starter was a great beginning and it got better as we ordered the meal. We had snapper and fish soup. Soup had so much seafood and flavor that it felt like a complete meal. I also enjoyed the low key atmosphere, fast service and very reasonable prices for food. Will be back for sure!
author: Ilya K.

description:
This was a nice, intimate place to grab dinner with the family. Everything was fresh and well cooked and the service was very on point. The food wasn't anything particularly special, but it was a good meal. 

Favorite part of the meal: dessert. They served a flourless chocolate cake with ice cream. That was a 5/5 dessert.
author: Alexander C.

description: This place has really gone down hill. Fish really poor quality. The Floating island was a joke, the meringue certainly not floating.
author: Nicholas W.

description: Came here tonight. In SF for one night on business and was looking for a place near my hotel that I could go by myself. Great little local place. Food was amazing and I kind of appreciated that I wasn't rushed. Great atmosphere. Had the crab cake appetizer and the sautéed sole. Bread and pesto was great. I'd definitely come back.
author: Alan T.

description: The food was OK but nothing spectacular . The service was cheerful and they were doing their best, but the restaurant is under-staffed (one server and one food runner). We waited ten minutes to be seated even though there was an empty table and nobody waiting ahead of us. The appetizers were delivered within a reasonable amount of time, but the main course took a long time to arrive -- and at that time the restaurant was only about 75% full, so it's probably painful when 100% full.
author: David O.

description:
This place was lovely. A good friend and I decided to indulge in their BYOB Wednesdays (wherein the corkage fee is waived of each person has 2 courses) and it was exactly what we wanted. The space is quite intimate with cozy booth seating. 

While there were some hiccups (a frazzled waitress who didn't seem to know the specials, some slightly under fried calamari) the atmosphere and friendly staff more than made up for it. 

As for the food, we both got fish specialties- I the blackened salmon and he the grilled trout. The portions were perfect and I loved being able to pick my sauce! Halfway through dinner a mutual friend walked by, spotted us, and joined us. The wait staff not only happily let him join us, they let the three of us stay until the very end (even though we were the only people there for almost an hour) and were very kind.  Would highly recommend this place for an intimate, more cozy-casual dinner!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Nice neighborhood restaurant with a good seafood menu.  We had the choice of salmon, trout, petrale sole or snapper, grilled, sautéed or poached with a selection of sauces.  All very good.

We started with mussels and calamari, both were delicious starters.  We all had salads, nice portions.  I had the sauté petrale with a peppercorn sauce, very good.  Everyone's entrees were good, the fish stew, and snapper.  

Service was excellent, friendly, I recommend this spot, especially when visiting Alamo Square.
author: Carole W.

description: Very good restaurant. Their bread and butter is fish of the day with their certain sauces. Today they had trout, sole, salmon, snapper, I got the sole in garlic and parsley butter with rice and vegetables. Very good. Would recommend again! Price extremely reasonable as well, even more so being in SF. Very close to Alamo park and the painted ladies. Small cozy feel, if you come during peak times or with no reservation you may have to wait. Owner very personable and you can tell he cares and actively involved in the activities. Pesto and olive oil for the bread is GREAT! Never had that mixture before.
author: Lucas O.

description:
A gem in San Francisco. We live down the street and passed this place many many times and couldn't believe it could be good. We finally tried it and it's amazing.

Fresh delicious fish. Nice escargot (it's French owned) and great appetizers and wines.
author: Alex P.

description: Huge fan of the service and the restaurant ambiance. The staff is wonderful and the food is just as good. Came here for NYE dinner service and it was perfect. We'll be back.
author: Joshua F.

description: You get what you pay for. Had the dinner special, which was reasonably priced. Trout with the tomato based sauce what ok. Kind of tasted like those frozen marinated fish with tomato you get from Trader Joes. Waited at least 15 mins before order taken (1 server during dinner service!). Had a blah experience here.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Ok peeps...yes service was uhm a bit slow and not the most entertaining but what you really come here for is the free corkage weds and/or the best deal of the century $14.50 prix fixe meal (can't be combined). 

Where can you get a seafood meal for $14.50?!

Here, that's where. We started with a delicious baked bread and pesto sauce (this comes standard) and we ordered one soup and one salad. The butternut squash soup was delicious and the herb/vinaigrette salad was also tasty. The entree that night was blackened trout which was hearty and cooked well. Finished with a meringue with caramel sauce which was good too. 

This is in our neighborhood so we will definitely be coming back. I think next time we will be taking advantage of the free corkage and order off the normal menu which also seemed to be delicious. I'm eyeing the lump crab cake, I'm salivating just thinking about it now at 10am. See you soon!
author: Guisela L.

description: The food was great, I had the rib eye steak and veggies cooked to my taste. The service with the waitress were satisfying, and had a great sense of humor.
author: Paul R.

description:
This place was great. I am not a seafood person so was a little wary about a hole in the wall seafood place. I tried a mussel - better than any I've had but not my fave. My friends were basically drinking from the bowl of mussels so I'm pretty sure they liked them. I ordered the blackened salmon with beurre blanc. It came with very good mixed veggies and ok rice. It was great! The salmon was cooked perfectly, and seemed very fresh.

Five stars for the flourless chocolate cake. I was expecting one of those frozen round things you can get at lots of places, but this was some kind of warm cake/brownie awesome thing. Not a giant portion size but that's ok - didn't need any more. Highly recommend. My friend got the creme brûlée and said it was the best she has had. 

We all left full and happy. I'll definitely go back! I would order the exact meal and substitute something for the rice. Oh! And the Malbec was quite good too! I wouldn't go if you're in a hurry, as it was a sit and chat and take your time pace of service - but this was perfect for us. Thank you!
author: A P.

description: Great service and food!  Stumbled across this on vacation in San Francisco and we were very happy we did.
author: Craig G.

description: Decided on Alamo based on other reviews. We were not disappointed. Service was friendly and attentive, and the food was delicious. Our group started with a crab cake and calamari. Both were outstanding. For main courses, between us, we had salmon and snapper - also delicious. A must for anyone looking for quality food and reasonable prices in a great space.
author: Paul S.

description: Price fixed menu is the best 15.50 for 3 courses...soup/salad, fish, and dessert.  Add bottle of rose for another 40.
author: Ben C.

description: A nice local place that is shockingly well priced. It's very reasonable for San Francisco. The place had a nice homey feel, and my friend and I shared some snails and some mussels as an appetizer. We then shared blackened trout with a sauce, followed by Creme Brulee. The waitress was very patient as my dining companion inquired as to where one of the daily fishes come from.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Came here for the first time last night to have dinner with a few of my girlfriends and absolutely fell in love with this place. It is a small, quaint neighborhood restaurant in Alamo Square. We sat next to the window and the booths along the wall have cushions and cute little pillows to make you feel nice and cozy. 

The menu is small but every dish looked incredible. Quality over quantity! The menu features American dishes with some French influence. And the majority of the menu are seafood dishes. There is also a large board on the wall which features some of their specials. Wine list was small but again, we had no problem with that because the wines were very good. We started with the crab cakes which were lightly crisp on the outside, moist on the inside. Great flavor! It came with a side salad, cucumbers, tomatoes, and their garlic herb aioli for dipping. Everything tasted fresh and full of flavor which really set the expectation for our entrees. I ordered the shrip & spinach risotto special and absolutely loved it! The shrimp had cajun seasoning on it (I think?) but wasn't too spicy. And the risotto was hearty and creamy. The ambiance combined with the food at this restaurant really gives you that homemade, comfort kind of feel. 

To sum it up, our cute little girls dinner turned into about 4 hours of pure enjoyment at this restaurant! We had a lot of wine, devoured all of our food, and one of the true highlights was Andre! He took such great care of us the entire time and was so friendly and fun to talk to. We ended up closing down the restaurant and he didn't mind at all! He even poured us some dessert wines at the end of the evening. The girls and I loved this place so much. Cannot wait to come back!
author: Chisholm T.

description: Excellent food all around from appetizer, entree to dessert.    I will definitely go back to try other dishes that I didn't tried last night.   Service was great.    Parking was limited, but I know where to search.
author: Hannah L.

description:
This place is adorable. Super quiet and peaceful place to have a nice intimate dinner. Had dinner with boyfriend and we will definitely be back. 

This place has been around since the 40's. I highly recommend it if you like seafood. The service wasn't that great but this hardly made a difference to the overall experience. 

We had the mussels, crab cake dinner, and the fish specialty. The mussels came with french fries, which is interesting. Overall the price, with a wine glass was only about $60. So we were pretty happy with the price as well.
author: Rose E.

description: Great spot. Will come back! Good wine, fresh fish,  romantic, but good for friends get together as well, reasonable prices and waitstaff was nice. What more can i want from a restaurant? :) this is our new favorite spot in sf.
author: Shira T.

description:
Heard great things about this place and from the reviews it also looked excellent. Was disappointed with the main courses. The blackened shrimp was not bad in taste but for a restaurant known for its seafood, the shrimp wasn't fresh. 

My friend got the crab cakes and didn't finish it because it was too dry and just not worth finishing. 

Other people at our table got a variety of the fish the restaurant had that day and the taste was good but fish quality questionable. 

My favorite thing there is the free sour dough bread with a basil olive oil dip and crispy calamari. You can't go wrong with fried calimari with lemon.
author: Rohenne L.

description: We are visiting San Francisco but wanted to find a restaurant that locals would go to. This restaurant is nestled right in between some house in a neighborhood by the Alamo square. It's very small, probably only 10-15 tables, but that made it feel cozy. The owner or manager was there and he was very helpful. They had several fish options for the day and he helped us decide what to get and how to have it cooked/sauced (snapper blackened with a green pepper sauce). It came with rice and sautéed carrots and squash and everything had lots of flavor and was cooked very well. The best thing about it - the price. We got an appetizer, two seafood entrees, and two cocktails (total, not each), and it was only $65. Think about how much that would cost at other seafood restaurants in town! We really enjoyed our meal here and would recommend it!
author: MacKenzie D.

description: I have gone to Alamo Square Seafood Restaurant on many occasions and I'm always glad that I went. Their seafood is fresh, great and reasonably priced. I am consistently pleased with the level of service and getting to meet the owner, Andre'. He is quite the character and always makes me and my party feel welcome and special. I can highly recommend this quaint neighborhood restaurant.
author: Byron C.

description: Horrible experience! We chose this place because it was considered an excellent neighborhood seafood restaurant, along with PJs Oyster House and Pacific Cafe, two places we have enjoyed. So came here on Sunday while in the city for a quick night out. Server (owner?) was incredibly rude when we asked questions about the menu. We placed our orders despite the cold service. From there, we were never asked how our meal was, if we would like another drink, or to refill our water. Rude service, lousy food, won't be be back ever.
author: Dana B.

description: Fish was fresh and tasted great.  Very nice atmosphere, great value, and the owner Andre is very friendly.  Hidden gem in SF!
author: Matt T.

description:
Delicious! I came here with a couple friends and we all selected the  3 course meal. This includes an appetizer, entree, and dessert all for a great price! :)

it's a cute little restaurant so not ideal for large groups but great for a date or small group catch-up.
author: Carina M.

description:
I had 6pm dinner reservations. The restaurant is tiny, hidden neighborhood gem that is cozy and I did not feel rushed during my time there. I was properly seated by the tall maître d or owner of restaurant. He checked in with me to see if everything was ok and I said I was waiting for my friend who was running late on the bus. He was ok with that. So finally my friend arrived and we both decided to go with the Fixed price menu that included the salad or soup, main entree of chef choosing and dessert.  Since this was a French restaurant we had to order the Escargot with garlic and butter for $8.00.  So our fresh yummy French bread (wish I had more!) came to our table first and it was so soft and tasty with the pesto sauce for dipping bread in. The salad arrived and it was quite tasty and good flavoring. Finally the main course arrived and it was the sole fish with White sauce. My friend's dish was a tad bigger than my fish as you can see from my photos. But that is okay, as I am on a diet. LOL We both enjoyed the dish and the sides. 
Last but not least was the French's Floating Island with sweet carmel sauce with strawberry! So much calories, but so good! 

Yummy in our tummies for all the excellent dishes. I ranked this place A. This French place does it right. If you have a budget, the fixed price is excellent way to go. Other items off the menu reads quite tasty and I would love to come back and order those!  Cheers to me dreaming of another visit back! 

Transportation is easy to get to with all the bus lines running nearby along Alamo square with the Painted Ladies houses. Remember you can have a stroll up at the park to see where that tv show Full House was filmed for the opening credits. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: Great place, waiter excellent. Food was perfect, price was fair. All around it was a good time. Chairs could be more comfy, thats the only shortcoming
author: dave d.

description:
Great deals on Wednesday when the corkage fee is waived.

Crab cake- super fresh, fried but not greasy. Highly recommend it. 

Sauteed snapper in provencal sauce - didn't love the sauce with the fish and thought it was too salty. Many people recommended beurre blanc- may be the better choice.

Flourless chocolate cake - solid. definitely get it with vanilla ice cream since the cake is a bit dry.

Portion is quite large. Best for two people to split one appetizer, one entree, one dessert.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Absolutely fantastic meal.  Seafood was cooked to perfection.  Price was quite reasonable.  This will be a regular stop for us!  Mussels w chorizo was delicious.  Sole Provençal was mouth watering.  Blackened salmon was outstanding.  Will be back next week!
author: Larry C.

description:
Treated my whole family out for belated-Christmas dinner here.

Pros:
- Great deal! $15 for 3-course meal (soup or salad, chef's choice of entree, dessert).
- Good food for the most part.
- Fish were cooked perfectly. We ordered the salmon and sole. Tender and flakey.
- Scallops in my risotto were HUGE.
- Fresh bread basket with delicious green dipping sauce. I think it's Pesto?
- Extra free dessert with Yelp check-in!
- Plenty of street parking. Or maybe we just got lucky.

Cons:
- Friendly, but extremely slow service. There were only two waitresses working the whole night.
- Had to ask multiple times to get refills on water.
- Items we could have done without were the fried calamari (too much breading) and seafood pasta (blue cheese sauce was very heavy).
- Small and tight space.

Overall, my family did enjoy it. My mom said she'll come back when her and my dad do date nights. My grandma, who's usually picky with food, didn't have any complaints! Entree portions looked small at first, but after bread, appetizers, and dessert, it's definitely filling. And even though dinner took over 2 hours, it was a nice way to force my family to all be together at the same table for the holidays!
author: Jessica C.

description: I went to this restaurant for the first time & the seafood was great.  Location is not the best (not in Alamo Square but in Fillmore area) & parking can also be a little difficult. Service was OK, depending on who you get, but food made up for mentioned short-comings.
author: Clifford Y.

description: Simple and delicious. This is tucked away in our neighborhood and ever since we discovered its secret awesomeness we go back at least once a month. This place reminds me of an older restaurant philosophy, one that gives the neighborhood what it wants - a mellow, no fuss, classy atmosphere with food you'd be proud to take anyone to. Nothing pretentious, just market-fresh fish cooked expertly, with great weeknight specials like no corkage or prix fix menus. Great wine menu, too. Love love love
author: Jenny M.

description: LOVED IT!!! Went here for a special night out on vacation and found it to be both a great value and great food. Also, quieter that most places we have visited in the city, which is a major plus. The atmosphere is intimate but not overly elegant. I especially loved the tuna carpaccio and crab cakes. They taste very fresh.
author: Curtis C.

description:
This was exactly the kind of place I was looking for after a few hours of power shopping on Hayes st. I needed to get away from the Opera crowds and find a quiet local place. Alamo totally fit the bill for that. Quaint and low key as others have mentioned the service is uneven. I was asked to move three times before they settled on my table for one.  The menu was about what I expected--pretty standard fare. 

A break basket was served with my wine and came with an interesting pesto olive oil dipping sauce. I ordered the crab cakes appetizer which arrived promptly and were nicely plated. However, they seemed too perfectly shaped to be hand patted and were stock full of filling. Maybe I'm spoilt by crab shacks on the Chesapeake bay. 

For the entree I chose one of the fishes of the day, snapper, grilled with the green peppercorn sauce which was actually kind of purple. The fish was a little dry, and I liked that they put the sauce on the side instead of smothering it. I enjoyed the fish and sauce as well as the excellent grilled vegetables. I skipped on the plain white rice. 

For dessert I had the profiteroles which were crisp and fresh. In this case, they did smother them in too much chocolate sauce. Less would have been more here. I paired that with a tawny port. 

Overall a nice meal and atmosphere, but the spotty service (I ordered a second glass of wine that. Ever arrived for example), and prefab crab cakes make it a three star for me.
author: Rita C.

description: Great seafood place!  You get to choose fish type (one out of four), method of preparation and sauce to go with it.  We tried salmon and sole -- delicious!  Also, had mussels for the appetizer.  Food-wise -- highly satisfying.  Service felt a little awkward, maybe because it was loud and the servers had a hard time hearing.  Also, based on the website photos, I expected a fancier place.  It's not fancy.  Very simple, actually.  However, once our expectations were adjusted a bit, we loved and definitely plan on coming back.
author: Inna G.

description: Another great dinner with friends at Alamo square seafood grill. Going out to eat is not just what's in your plate, it's sharing a moment with people you care for in an environment where you feel appreciated. André, the owner, will make sure this happens. His joie de vivre will make the food taste even better. Go for the fish, the wine, the desserts, the ceviche and the atmosphere. You won't regret it!
author: Eric K.

description: Easily one of the most underrated restaurants in the city.  Fresh rotating seafood menu, with surprisingly good steak and roasted chicken entrees.
author: Brad T.

description:
Fell in love with this place! Stumbeled upon this place while exploring Alamo Square.
This place is your go to place when you want heart warming homemade food when you don't want to spend too much. 
First time I had the chicken- it was moist and delicious! The mashd potatoes are amazing as well.
Second time, I got the beef burguignon - of course it is perfect melt in your mouth meat!
Def coming back for the seafood.
And I can't forget to mention the friendly staff! Our server was Nohemi, she was amazing! She knows the menu pretty well and drinks. You can ask for her suggestions.
author: Bulgaa G.

description: They called multiple time to make help with reservation. And the food was sooo on the money. I will make sure to come back just meet and greet the employees again. Let's not forget the food
author: Herman M.

description:
I came here for the first time for a friend's birthday dinner (11.3.16). For appetizers, we had the mussels and ahi tuna. The bread though came late. The broth from the mussels was so good that we dipped our bread in it! :)

For the main entrees, we had: snapper, trout, seafood pasta, and the steak. They were all tasty and flavorful. My favorite is the seafood pasta!

There was only 1 server and it was pretty busy-- but Ken did a great job! He also accommodated the free dessert that was advertized in Yelp (if we check in). He offered us 2 desserts and we chose tiramisu and creek brûlée.

Thank you Ken! You held the fort down! :) 

I'm for sure going back here in the near future.
author: Emil J.

description:
2.5

Birthday dad.
Likes Seafood.
Dislikes Scoma's.

Neighborhood spot.
Low key.
Alamo Seafood.

Easy reservation.
Parking lot.
Fishy smell
Upon arrival.

Prix fixe?
No thanks.
Lamb stew?
Yes please.
Hubby approved.

Seafood pasta
Provencale sauce
Spoiled by  
Spoiled mussels.

Fish dishes
Select sauce
Cooking method.

Add rice
Add veggies
Reportedly salty.

Cream puffs
Chocolate drizzles
Whipped cream.

Tiramisu dessert
With candle
Up top.

The End.
author: Amy C.

description: Delicious.  Cozy. Neighbor-hoody and just bustling enough.  Delicious reasonable (yes; you heard me: REASONABLE) bistro.  Try the escargot if you like snails...don't bring your beef eating self; bring your lover of all things water loving: fish, fish, and more fish.  How do you like it? Broiled?  Blackened?  With butter and wine?  Garlic? Shallots??? Absolutely yummy. Wonderful personal attention.   Doesn't feel here the least bit pretentious.  I think this place is a place for regulars.  Locals. San Franciscans who are tired of being gouged for good food and personal attention. Bon Appetit!
author: Darby W.

description:
Such a bummer!
My boyfriend was really excited to take me here as a few years ago this was a great spot that he enjoyed while living in Hayes Valley.
While it is a cute, cozy, @ times romantic little restaurant, the cuisine just isn't up to par. Sorry but don't waste your stomach on this place. It seems like a good choice but it really wasn't. Service was not that great either :(
author: Ashley G.

description:
I came here for dinner with a friend a few weeks ago. Service was great, but one of our glasses was pretty dirty, which was a bit off-putting, but we got a replacement. Looking at the menu, there are some other things I would have liked to have tried, so maybe I will come back soon and order different dishes.

Steamed Mussels Meuniere (4/5) Nicely cooked mussels with a tasty sauce. The fries on the side were nice as well.

Seafood Pasta (3/5) - Lots of seafood, but this dish was definitely too rich for my taste. I think that other people would enjoy it, but I'm not the biggest fan of creamy food.
author: Cynthia M.

description: great food and was delivered to our table at the perfect timing. Wasn't rushed at all!
author: Jee Mee H.

description:
We were here for a birthday dinner with a party of 8.  Small neighborhood restaurant located 1 block from Alamo Square and the painted ladies.  Street parking was real easy.

I had made my reservation on Open Table, then called day before to confirm.  We got there a few minutes early and our table was ready for us.  Alamo Square specializes in fish, tonight they had sole, salmon, snapper and trout.  The let you a choose how to have it cooked - blackened, grilled, poached, etc. and the sauce as well.  Well, even though it's a fish place only the birthday girl ordered fish.  She had the salmon appetizer and the sole.  3 ordered the crab cake dinner, 2 the rib eye steak, 1 seafood pasta and 1 beef bourgonion.  Go figure.

All the food was great.  My beef bougonion was a little on the rich side for me, but I should have know better.  My daughter thought both the salmon and the sole were excellent.  And the rib eye and crab cake eaters were quite happy as well.

Service was excellent.  Our water glasses were always full and they immediately responded to the few requests we had.  Prices are very reasonable.  Only knock I have is the portions are on the small side - perhaps to keep prices down.  We were kinda full, but not stuffed and everyone finished off their plates.  That's OK.  It left room for ice cream at Bi-Rite a few blocks away.
author: Steve G.

description:
Food was just ok. But the service was *remarkably* bad.

It started before we even got to the restaurant. Reserved via open table, and the host called 20 min before our reservation--while we were in a cab on the way over--to tell us they couldn't seat us and asked us to come an hour later. No explanation. No apologies. She acted as if she was doing us a favor even getting us in, even though we had reservations. When we got there we waited at the entrance, you know as you do at every other restaurant in the world. I smiled and made eye contact with the host, and she gestured us over to her, on the other side of the dining room, presumably because it was inconvienent for her to walk over to greet us. I was going to say that it felt like I was at the bank, but the tellers there actually smile and say hello, etc.

The host was also our server, brought wine, presented it to me, but didn't wait for me to taste it before filling everyone else's glass. The second bottle was left on the table by our other server, unopened. As she walked away she said "it's a screw top so you can open it yourself when you're ready" (my glass was empty on the table). Of course everything else was slow, wine was pour exactly once, and water service nonexistent. They are obviously understaffed by design so I get it--I would do the minimum too if there were only 1.5 people covering the entire dining room. My main issue is with the attitude. You can be busy and short staffed while still making people feel like you want them to be there.

If all this sounds petty to you, consider that there are literally thousands of restaurants in the city that ARE glad to have you as customers and won't treat you as an imposition. I suggest going to one of those instead. The food at Alamo Sq. really isn't good enough to have this kind of attitude.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Very fairly priced but the 3 star rating is mostly due to the service and portion size.

It's not that the service was unfriendly, they were just understaffed. There was 1 server and 1 busser for a completely full restaurant. I'm actually surprised of how well they did all things considered. 

We did the prefix menu for $14.50 and although it was tasty, the portions were just too tiny to fill you up for dinner. For the price that totally makes sense but maybe you call it out on the menu or recommend getting some appetizers.
author: Sam A.

description: Always curious about this place- hadn't tried even after living just a few blocks away for 5 years. Last night gave it a go. Space is pretty cute but food was average at best. Passable in Lodi but quite underwhelming for this city's standards. Got tartare, fried calamari, seafood stew and a side of vegetables. Oh and an $8 bottle of Perrier. Tartare was the best thing of the night- seasoned simply with soy and sesame oil- although the greens underneath became inedibly salty from the excessive amount of dressing. Calamari was OK- flour breading was light but falling off the squid. Seafood stew was clearly all the odd bits that weren't getting ordered a la carte. Seemed a bit odd to have that many types of fish in one bowl (salmon & tuna especially). The entire dish was not very appetizing and didn't pop with any vibrant, fresh flavor. Vegetables were your standard wedding steam-tray trio of zucchini, squash and carrots with pre-ground black pepper specks. Didn't drink but the 'free corkage' rules seems a bit sheisty. Just sayin.
author: Anthony R.

description:
I'm stingy with 5-Star reviews, but the combination of great food, amazing service, and reasonable prices really earned this place all five stars. I really don't know how they manage to serve such good quality and portions of fish for the same price most places sell a bowl of pasta.

Service:
This is where this place really shines. Our waitress Suzzie (I hope I spelled it right) was really friendly, handled all of our needs promptly, and kept our water glasses full the entire night. When my mother's fish was not as well done as she would have liked, Suzzie immediately took it back to fix it. Even after cooking it some more, my mom was clearly not happy, but didn't say anything. Suzzie picked up on this, and tried to make it right. When my mom wouldn't let her take it away, Suzzie brought over an extra glass of wine, and later a desert, to help turn that negative experience around. This kind of attentiveness is hard to find, and really takes the dining experience to the next level.

Food:
I had Grilled Atlantic Salmon with Beurre Maitre d'Hotel (garlicky butter). The fish was a generous portion (I'd guess 6oz) and came with some tasty rice and veggies on the side. The Beurre Maitre d'Hotel was a little mild for my tastes, but I grew up in a house where garlic was the spice of choice, so it takes a lot of garlic for me to taste it any more. I split the Creme Brûlée and Blueberry Crisp for desert with my family, and it was gone in less than a minute. Both tasted great, but my preference goes to the Creme Brûlée
author: Graham B.

description: I came here for dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday. It was a very intimate place to host a birthday celebration. I was happy that it was quiet so we really got to enjoy ourselves and not have to worry about disturbing other people. The food was good, but my only complaint was that the portion size was a little smaller than I was expecting. I liked how you got to chose the fish you wanted as well as how you want it prepared. Additionally, you can also pick a sauce to accompany your fish dish. I would come back here to get good fish and to have a quiet, intimate dinner with friends.
author: Lynn T.

description: I went here for my birthday. I had 20 friends attending. I chose this restaurant because they had a prix fixe 3 course meal for $14.50 Wed-Sat from 5:30-7:00 pm. When we got there, they told us that only 2 per table were allowed for the prix fixe! So only 8  out of the 20 could have the prix fixe. If I knew that beforehand I wouldn't have chosen this restaurant. That's false advertising! The only reason I chose this restaurant was to keep our bill low for my friends!
author: Kumi Y.

description: The mussels and blackened snapper with beurre blanc sauce was incredible. Very Nice French seafood restaurant. Great ambiance.
author: Emilien F.

description: Great food, great service, great ambiance.  A French bistro in Alamo Square.  We're so lucky!
author: Mo J.

description:
This place is quintessentially French.  From the friendly, relaxed paced service to the homemade, high quality taste of the food, my thoughts were drawn back to my time in the south of France. The days spent in the hills or bicycling along the beach, and the evenings with wine and friends in quaint little restaurants like this. 

It's a rare find. In a city with many choices for fine dining French cuisine, seldom does one stumble upon a restaurant that truly captures not only the flavor, but also the atmosphere of authentic French dining.

Bravo
author: Ryan B.

description:
I was super excited to visit this restaurant tonight. One of my good friend was in town tonight and we decided to go celebrate his birthday there. I had made reservation tonight on OPENTABLE for 7:30pm for 3 people.  We arrived early around 7:15pm.  I enter the restaurant and told I believe a "French, Tall, Skinny frame...Collar shirt and jeans guy" that we are early but if there's no table yet...We will wait but letting you know that we are here.  He was absolutely extremely RUDE and said "Not yet...GO WAIT outside".

7:30 came and still no table or anyone giving us any update.   We waited outside with another couple.

7:42 pm - The French guy I'm assuming that he's the owner...came out with 2 glasses and a bottle of White Wine...Went over to the couple that is waiting outside and offer a glass of wine to both of them.  He walk back into the restaurant after pouring them each a glass of wine and did not acknowledge us or give us updates about our table.

7:52 pm - Finally, he come out with both hands up in the air and said "OOOOOKAAAY"  Table is ready...no apology!!!  Seated us and we were promptly served water.

8:04 pm - Again, The French guy comes over and start taking our order...Not half way taking our order he put his order pad down...said "Sorry...I need to go say good bye...to a party of 6 that was leaving"  He goes out side for more than 5 mins...start taking selfie with them.

8:10 pm - My friends and I decided to leave the restaurant...On our way out, we told him that we are not going to dine here...and his respond was "OK".

This is one of the worst experience for me and my friends tonight at this place.  It's so sad that this restaurant has high hope but definitely lack customer service.  Visiting the ALAMO SQUARE SEAFOOD GRILL was certainly an experience to remember, but one that I never hope to repeat and would not wish upon anyone else. If you are tempted to try this restaurant for seafood...GO SOMEWHERE ELSE LIKE TADICH GRILL OR WATER BAR.

To the french guy...You absolutely need to learn about manner and excellent customer service. You are so rude and disrespectful!!!  I hope that this review will help others when selecting restaurants to eat in SF.  I will spread the words to people that I know and let them know not to come to your restaurant!!!
author: Perapol D.

description:
Extremely rude waitstaff. I live in the neighborhood and ate here about 7 years ago and remember enjoying it. So, when I needed a good spot to celebrate an important night with my fiancé, it seemed like a good option, and we made a reservation a week ahead. When we arrived, the place was busy and the table wasn't ready. This wouldn't have been a problem by itself. We happily went outside to the bench to wait. A few minutes later, another couple finished up and vacated their table. We waited another 10 minutes while the table was left unbussed and no one made an effort to prepare it for us. About 15 minutes after our reservation time, I went back in to check on things. The woman working the front of the house got in my face, saying "I told you to wait outside!" and got angry at me for checking on the table. We left at that point at had a delightful dinner at the Boxing Room instead. 

I will never return to this place.
author: Bennet M.

description: Hands down one of the best piece of fish I have had in a long time. This very cute neighborhood restaurant is a hidden gem. I almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want to many people finding out about this place. The service is amazing and wines are great as well. We had the tuna tartar 5 stars if I could give 10 I would. Also orders ahi tuna highly recommended and also Ono fish. IF they have it on the menu when you are here it's a must have. Must see Nohemi knows her wines and food :)
author: Travis Ryan S.

description:
Delicious and well priced food is definitely the draw here. Cute cozy location too! However the service was perhaps the closest I've had in all the restaurants I've been to in SF in the last three years. Was a Friday night and we had a reservation and they didn't seat us until 30 minutes past the reservation time. We weren't approached to order for another 30 minutes so at that point it's one hour past our reservation time...

Sad because I'd love to give them a higher rating. May try again at some other time since my friends love the place. Fish options were solid. Wine was reasonable. Calamari alright. The dessert was A+ (merengue)
author: Magda M.

description:
I'd rate the food 4 stars. It is cooked well in the French Bistro style with simplicity and attention. I left with a very satisfied belly. The price is also quite reasonable for what you get. 

However the service is totally uninviting. The servers need to learn how to smile. My wife and I both value politeness and we use all of our please and thank-yous whenever dining and try our best to be respectful to waitstaff because we understand it is hard work, but it would be nice to have some politeness returned! We were sat in the corner and we saw bread being delivered to all the tables, but no bread to us for some unexplained reason. When our order was taken the server didn't write anything down, so of course the long wait for our appetizer was exceedingly long because the server forgot the appetizer we ordered. Her response was, "oh, you wanted escargot" with no apologies. The appetizer was delivered after the meal was complete and to add insult to injury it was first delivered to the neighboring table by mistake. 

It is disappointing that the service was so bad because the food was really good.
author: Anthony S.

description: Don't eat here. Horrible, horrible service! There is seriously 1 waitress and  helper for the entire restaurant. The food was almost as bad. Tuna carpaccio was almost frozen. It tasted okay but was so cold that it was appetizing and weird. I ordered the rib eye medium rare but it came out medium well. It wasn't even worth sending it back because who knows how long it would take, and they would probably mess it up again. The 2 stars are only for the quaintness of interior.
author: Andrea A.

description:
Classic French cuisine for extremely reasonable prices. I came here for mothers day and it was such a treat. I have been a classically trained Chef for more than 20 years and I trained for a bit in France. This restaurant hits all the notes of a bistro style restaurant. Great wine list with reasonably priced wines. We even got dessert. Yum 
Definitely will be back
author: Tanya S.

description: Made a reservation and walked through the door 8 min late. They then gave the table to a larger party that had also just arrived citing a 10 min rule. Clearly they saw a larger bill and lost two local patrons
author: Ariel L.

description: Can't say anything bad about the food. However, the experience was not something to write home about. Service staff was surly and unprofessional. The waitress stood there twilling a rubber object while telling us the specials. No smile, no greeting.  Won't be going back for awhile. They need to train their staff, if that was the owner, she needs to take a vacation to get chip off her shoulder. I owned my own restaurant so I totally know what bad and good service are!!!
author: Reggie Q.

description:
A agree this restaurant is a gem.  I have always enjoyed dinners at this restaurant until  I encountered the server Naomi. I have no idea why she seemed to go out of her way to be rude but it really was horrible.  Naomi asked my mom who is 86 and myself to wait to be seated even though we got there early and only two tables were occupied.  My mom was holding onto me as she is frail and we did not want to bring her walker in with us as space it tight.  Naomi ignored us leaving us standing.  My mom could not wait any longer so I  took  her to the corner table close to the bathroom where we like to  sit.   Again Naomi ignored us except to give us an angry look.  My sister joined us at which point Naomi approaches the table and says " you can't sit here   We asked why.   I explained my mom needs to be near the bathroom and this was our favorite table.  Naomi said "this is a table for four and you are only 3 people  you can't sit here"  Her tone was harsh and hostile.  It was clear she did not want to help us and at that point that we would have to leave as she was the only server and her attitude was intolerable.  We went out for a nice and time left the restaurant feeling like dogs being kicked   
     I left my name and number two days later to ask the owners to call.  I am sure they would have called if Naomi  had given them the message. I would like to go back to the restaurant someday as I have always enjoyed my meals.
author: marie n.

description: Extremely good value for your money. I took two starters: ahi tuna and mussels, the latter one could have been the size of a regular dish and cost only little more than $13 (+tax). Really good. There is frank Sinatra style music playing, decorations are nice and the place in general is comfy. Would come back here.
author: Liisa H.

description: Acceptable food and unpleasant customer service. It took a while to get order taken and food delivered on table. I would not be back.
author: Carol k.

description:
We ate here twice in five days and enjoyed the friendly and unpretentious neighborhood atmosphere.  The menu isn't long, but daily specials increase the odds that everyone will find something appealing to eat. I enjoyed a comforting dish of beef bourguignon and mashed potatoes more than the blackened snapper in provencal sauce from my first visit, which needed more salt - I think.  Dessert choices were interesting.  I had floating island: it looks ridiculously huge but I had no problem finishing it - those egg whites are so light.

The two women who served us were both very thoughtful and approachable. They seated diners in different corners of the restaurant to give everyone space for conversations. Banquettes and pillows add charm to the relaxed atmosphere.
author: Cathy W.

description: Disappointed with this second visit, such a different experience. They were much busier since it was no corkage fee and Wednesday. My shrimp risotto was not the same one I had last time. This was more red sauce based instead of white. Super SALTY! A few people in my table also ordered the same thing and experienced the same saltiness. I miss the delicious risotto I had last time. The waiter was nowhere to be found and seemed irritated when I asked for water. He also made a rude joke about the kind of wine we brought. Not sure if I'll be back.
author: Ana D.

description: The Service here is the absolute worst! We called ahead and were told to come at a specific time and even with open tables they took forever to seat us and even longer to bring the food out. I think we were there almost 2 hours before we got our food brought out.
author: Divya R.

description: Got here and we were seated promptly. We went on a Wednesday night so there is no corkage fee if you purchase two entrees.  Service was excellent, hostess apologized for our previous experience. Food was fantastic! We never have a bad meal here.
author: Jessica L.

description: Very good place. Small, simple but good. Staff was extremely nice. Food is fresh and very good. Must try.
author: Haile J.

description: Been here a couple times, and both were fantastic. I know there are alot of seafood options in the bay area, but this is a quaint and charming spot to spend your buck. I love that they change their menu regularly. Nice decor and great staff.
author: Carmella L.

description:
Rainy Friday nights call for a no-frills, comforting dinner. Yelp lead me to Alamo Square Seafood Grill, as we were looking for a casual, seafood restaurant to accommodate our party of 4. 

The restaurant is just as others describe it. Really tiny but such a cozy nook nestled in the heart of Alamo Square. Tables are close together but somehow didn't feel too close to neighbors or that the volume was out of control. 

Alamo Square is known for their fish options which you can customize the type of fish, cooking method, and sauce. I opted for the snapper, blackened, with peppercorn sauce per the waiter's recommendation. Peppercorns are normally not something I would go for, but the combination was delicious and the sides (brussels and rice) were perfect accompaniments. There was a mix-up with our friend's entree which meant he waited a few extra minutes. It was no biggie but they brought us a free (and delicious) creme brulee to make up for it.

This is exactly the type of restaurant and experience I crave, we will be back!
author: Brianna M.

description: Made a reservation for a large group. We showed up a few minutes late -- 9 min to be exact -- and were told they wouldn't seat us due to a strict late policy for 10 minutes or later. The waitress acknowledged we hadn't arrived later than 10 min, but they'd already given up our table and she was entirely unapologetic. I've eaten here several times over the years but never again after the way we were treated.
author: Jon P.

description:
This was probably one of the worst dining experiences ever and here's why:

1. no one (as in wait staff) made eye contact with us for over 15 minutes after being seated. No "i'm coming" "i'm sorry this is taking longer than expected" "I'll be with you soon" looks or acknowledgement of any kind.

2. we ordered the escargot and the muscles to start. The escargot has absolutely no flavor - way under salted and just not tasty at all. The muscles were way past their prime. I can still taste the minerally "off" flavor in my mouth as I type this out. After 2 muscles each my husband and i decided not to have any more and when the waitress (ages later) collected our dishes asked if everything was ok ; my husband said "the muscles were a bit off" and she replied (laughing) "yes i can see, I can see".... WTF?

3. I ordered the baramandi grilled with the Beurre Blanc sauce. After i ordered it i had a thought and a worry that i probably should have asked for the sauce on the side. And thank god i didn't ask that as i would have had a cup of NOTHING on the side. The fish was as tasteless as ... well you get my drift. Horrible, how do you stuff grilled fish up (terrible quality is how!!!!).

Every time we drove past this place i felt bad that we hadn't tried it yet as it looked like a potential "hidden secret" or cute local that i could get to quite easily. Yet my first experience was SUPER disappointing. I'd rather stick pins in my eyes than go back it was that bad. What the hell is wrong with the people who gave this place 4-5 stars? This place is the absolute pits!
author: Julia B.

description:
Alamo Square Seafood Grill is a 1st rate neighborhood restaurant.  We have enjoyed dining there twice; both times excellent!

The Coq au vin and Beef Bourguignon were both exceptional - as were the desserts, Floating Island and Apple tart.  Moreover, considering the quality of the food, the prices are moderate.

Finally our server, Emma, was not only gracious and efficient - but when my wife had difficulty connecting to Lyft, Emma had the computer skill to solve the problem and get us a ride.
author: L L.

description: Was looking for a nice neighborhood restaurant with good seafood. Was greeted at the door by a rude young hostess who sat us at a table and proceeded to leave with no menus or drink orders taken for the next 10 minutes. There were very few people in the restaurant, which made us skeptical. But then, when she finally returned to the table the only thing she asked was if we were ready to order (without giving us water or taking our drink order at this point), so we left.
author: Joe O.

description: love this place, fantastic fresh sea food, and the owner is the nicest guy in the world, had a great time talking to him and learning about the area. Stayed right across the street, nice little hotel.
author: Doug M.

description: Excellent seafood! The seared tuna with Brussels sprouts was amazing! Friendly service too! I highly recommend this place. It's tucked away on Fillmore but worth searching for.
author: Ben W.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Really delicious and very reasonably priced. The prix Fixe is always good and I love the ability to get a great fresh fish entree whenever I come. Wonderful service.
author: Ish H.

description:
3.5 Stars.  I need that half star Yelp - help me out here.  Alamo Square Seafood Grill is aptly named.  The food is definitely fish-forward and serving up some mean simple foods.  The darkly lit room is flooded with artwork amongst the tiny tables squeezing in it's patrons. The window view is lined with lit-up trees begging for rainy weather, strangely reminiscent of a different city... dare I say Chicago?  

Prix-fixe menu is the way to go for both price and options. The potato-leek soup was stellar. Super simplistic in it's taste and presentation with floating croutons resting on top, but none-the-less amazing.  My company paid a little extra to substitute the Trout Salad and it was also fantastic.  Some say a bit "luke-warm", but I thought it was a perfect balance or cold greens mixed with a cozy bed of fish laid on top. The cut potatoes and red onions added a bit of character to this dish.  The entree was more blackened trout swimming in a peppercorn sauce and grilled vegetables afloat. Although the seasoning on the veggies were a bit bland the fish made up for it with it's overly-salted bite.  Obviously the best was saved for last with the Apple-Bread pudding coming in to cleanse our palate. Fresh strawberries lined the plate as our taste buds danced around each bite.

I want to give this space 4 stars but feel as if some fine-tuning could be had.  A very positive 3.5 stars for me.  Enjoy and rate it for yourself.
author: Kevin J.

description:
They do have a musky smell when you enter. 
The server was slow so ordering was long winded.
The menu was simple and inexpensive so I think people give them an extra star for that. $15 for prix fix is almost a double take. 
It is good simple food. Nothing to write home about except it is probably a good neighborhood place. I would come back.
author: Alison W.

description:
One of my great restaurant finds in the city.  Very quaint environment. Superb service and great value. 

The crab cakes were fantastic.  I had the swordfish which was one of the specials today. Very very fresh and cooked to perfection. The creme brûlée was also very good.  Great Caramelized  crust.  I definitely recommend.
author: Steve Y.

description: Surprisingly excellent meal. A small neighborhood restaurant with an intimate atmosphere. Started off with escargot. It was amazing  Comparable to the escargot I had in Paris.  I ordered the grilled trout and my wife ordered the pan fried chicken. We were both thrilled with our meals. We highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Steve C.

description: This is my favorite place for good food and good service. Their desserts are the must. The Creme-brulee is one of the best. Every penny is worth here.
author: Kwn K.

description:
+ : the friendliness of the french speaker server, the fresh french baguette (hard to find in the us) served with some pesto, the atmosphere of the restaurant, the grilled fish
- : the "dirty" glasses and cutleries (probably not well dried), way too much butter in the shrimp risotto
author: Stéphanie G.

description: The crab cakes are really good and we love the fact that you get to choose how the fish is cooked, and which sauces they use. Somewhat tough getting a table though so go on a week day!
author: Scott S.

description:
I wasn't exactly wowed by this place. 
The place is small and cramped. The service was lackluster. There were three of us dining there, and they failed to bring out the dinners all at the same time. We sat there waiting for about 7 minutes as we waited for the last dinner to come, so we could all eat together. I had the rainbow trout that wasn't that great, and a rather small fish. It was served with veggies that seemed to be mushy and overcooked. 
The beer list consists of three beers. Not a great selection, and none of them paired well with the fish. They do have an impressive wine selection, and it's half off of wine on Tuesdays. 
They offered a free dessert with Yelp check-in, which was creme brulee. They were out of some of the other desserts that they offered. 
The waiter seemed to have his hands full, and didn't return with the check for quite some time. 
The best part of the whole meal was the pesto that they offer with the bread while you're waiting, and waiting, and waiting for your food. 
The restaurant was clean, but not very well lit. Parking can be a challenge.
I don't think I'll be back.
author: Curt C.

description:
Great food ,ambiance and service. 
We had blackened red snapper and trout 
And the best cream bulee ever 
The reason I give it 4 because if the fish would be served more hot it would be much better
author: Eli F.

description: Went there because it was nearby and we wanted seafood but didn't expect such a delicious dish. I would definitely recommend it! And try the chocolate cake!
author: Jannine S.

description: The food was great the last time I ate here so I decided to bring my friends from Texas here. Made reservations for 7:45, arrived at 7:45, waited outside in the cold until 8:35. Hostess never even came out to say anything. Yet a family of 6 was seated around 8pm as soon as they arrived. We just left to get Mediterranean takeout instead. Never coming back again.
author: Andy L.

description:
You know....a hyper local place that tells me their red snapper was caught near hawaii always raises suspicion.  I actually asked where it's from he said Hawaii. Red Snapper *only* swims in the gulf and what we were handed was a pacific rock fish.  I didn't want to cause trouble, so my friend got it anyways.  I opted for crab cakes at this point.  

So...the crab cakes were lovely.  The 'red snapper' was also quite nice but was the perhaps mistaken Pacific Rock Fish, John Snapper, or perhaps a different snapper and not Red Snapper (it was too heavy...red snapper is light).  I should have argued but I was in a polite mood. If the plate were actually bad tasting I would have been harsher here...but ya - don't sell me a fish from Hawaii that actually doesn't swim there.

EDITED: Comment pointed out it could have been just a different type of snapper (though not a 'red' one)...so I made a slight adjustment to wording and incremented the rating score.
author: David S.

description:
I can only repeat what the other 5-star reviews have said. Where can you find such good french cooking at such a reasonable price in San Francisco? Why there isn't a line out the door, I don't know.

I had the pri-fixe (trout with pepper sauce) and my companion had crab cakes, mussels and creme brûlée.

A great meal, perfectly sized, with great service.
author: Alan H.

description: Food was delicious. And waitress Suzy was awesome and cute. We will come back.. Its not far from home.
author: E F.

description:
Service: 
Service was definitely well presented. It was a lady, I believe her name was Suzie, Suzy, Suzzie, Im not sure how to spell her name(Sorry server!), but she always came back just to ask us how we were doing and made sure that my kids were comfortable in a more elegant setting. She knew the menu like she created it. Job well done. 5 Stars

Food: 
We had the calamari, mussels, and two other seafood platters. Food was amazing, the only downside would be that the food was quite salty for my palette. But other than the saltiness, food was good. 3.5 stars

Location and Ambiance:
Very nice place in a suburb like area in San Francisco. Small, but elegant. No parking lot, so good luck on finding parking. All in All 3.5 stars
author: Michael G.

description:
This was our third time here and it is always great. I love the mix & match fish entrees - your fish, cooked your way, in your sauce. 

Also had the muscled in the cream sauce this time - delicious!
author: Amanda J.

description:
I LOVE Alamo Square Seafood Grill.

Reasons why I love this place:

1) Atmosphere- I love the fact that I feel like this place is a local gem.  I love getting a warm hello and a few jokes from Andre when we walk in. I love how it's a perfect romantic atmosphere for couples but at the same time has a lively environment making it a great group place for friends.

2) Food- The mussels are amazing.  I want to drink the broth b/c they are THAT good (prefer the chorizo but both are fantastic).  At this moment, they are my all time favorite mussels.  The specials are always amazing (scallops and shrimp risotto = yum yum yum). The fish soup is delicious and the fish pre fixe is always great!

3) Prices- I LOVE that this place is so reasonably priced.  The portions are large with prices not breaking the bank.  No corkage Wednesday? 1/2 price bottle Tuesday?  Sign me up!
