Andre, thanks for creating such a special place with delicious food.  We always are excited to come eat here!

(Not 5 stars b/c sometimes there is a wait even with a reservation and the rib eye isn't my favorite dish but I guess our fault for ordering beef at a seafood place!)
author: Rachel S.

description: Forget this place. Food is just ok. Service is not good. $7.50 for a bottle of IPA. The ceviche had little seafood at all. The muscles tasteless and cold. Enough already. Skip this place
author: Bob D.

description:
I totally love this place.
Perfect for all occasions!
Good prices for the excellent quality of food...
Just would love to see swordfish on the menu more.
Love it!
author: Stephan C.

description: Came here with a few friends and although the service was slow everything else was wonderful. They have a limited menu which I can understand since the place is small, but didn't offer a lot of variety. I ended up going with the vegetation dish because I'm not a seafood eater, and chose the pasta plate. The server ended up bringing me the risotto which I didn't want to point out since it had taken over 40 minutes to finally get our food. I really liked the risotto so maybe it was for the best!
author: Hoku L.

description: This place should not be missed! The food was incredibly prepared and even more incredibly priced. Calamari appetizer was perfectly fried and the batter was crisp and not heavy. Consider getting the fish of the day dish (they usually have 4 to choose from) & you get to select how prepared and which sauce. The shrimp risotto was extremely flavorful. Found on street parking one block away, so it was like hitting lotto. Go and enjoy.
author: Dave A.

description:
If there ever was a neighborhood gem, this would be it. We went on a Monday night for a nice, relaxed dinner. I love that it's tucked in the neighborhood - have always walked by and wanted to try it. Atmosphere is really chill and cozy. Alice was a wonderful host and helped our indecisive selves choose something tasty from the menu :)

Food was great - crab cakes for our appetizer were delicious. I got the fish special and my partner got the ahi tuna - both were tasty. We'll be coming back!
author: Jessica T.

description:
Come on a Monday! 1/2 off wine bottles. Great service and knowledge of wine selection. 
Relatively small menu but enough variety to satisfy most tastebuds. 
Mussels for an appetizer and ask for seconds on the bread dipping sauce! :)
author: Liz Y.

description: We wandered in here just looking for a quick bite to eat and ended up with a great meal. Suzi was our server and she was wonderful. From the moment we entered she was attentive and helpful. Here suggestions were spot on.  My seafood pasta was one of the many daily specials and it was certainly special. The blue cheese sauce was what caught my attention and the dish certainly met my expectations. The quantity and quality of the seafood was exceptional.  The only change I would make would be to use a different noodle than spaghetti (to avoid splashing the sauce). With the exception of Creme Brule, the desert list seldom temps me, but there were several items that called out tonight.  In the end, the table shared a Creme Brule and a blueberry crisp. Both were worth the extra calories. For the price, I don't think I have had better food or service anywhere else!
author: Ted B.

description:
This place deserves a more exotic name. Something French, like "Le Salon de Poisson." Yeah, I like that. True, they specialize in fish, but it felt much more like a cozy, French brasserie than a grill, and I'd hate to think folks are judging it as a boring American resto when it's actually quite a gem. So there, assumptions dispelled.

Wednesday is free corkage night, a popular event in the neighborhood. I made a reservation just to be safe, and we were seated immediately, before the BYO crowds arrived around 7. The menu is small and simple, and predominantly French, aside from the excess of fish. They offer 5 catches per day, and there are about 5 different ways you can have it prepared - grilled, sauteed, poached, blackened, or "buerre" (buttered!), making it a very customizable experience. 

We started with the lump crab cakes, which had great flavor but were a strange grey-ish color. We noticed the oddity, but kept eating assuming there must be a gourmet explanation for it. Then, the Mahi Mahi prepared Provential style (with tomatoes, capers, olives). It was a good, simple dish...cooked well but could have used more sauce. We ended with the famous profiteroles, a dessert I'm no stranger to. Anything drenched in thick chocolate sauce and stuffed with ice cream is going to elicit some happiness, but I must say the pastry puffs themselves seemed extra-crusty...too crusty to be fresh. 

I enjoyed the whole vibe of the place: dark and intimate with lively servers. Some guy who appeared to be the manager spoke French the whole night, probably to up the charm-factor. I decided not to blow my cover by letting him know I speak/understand enough French to pick up on snarky comments. At one point he poured us some water and commented "Ce n'est pas trop cher" (it's not too expensive), which made me think he was either just being clever, OR was hinting that we were cheap-a$$es (we shared an app, entree and dessert - we didn't have gigantic French appetites that night). Who knows...
author: Nique F.

description:
We have eaten there twice before and enjoyed it. Tonight was our last time due to poor service and meh food. I ordered the rib eye steak medium rare. (And yes, I realize ordering steak at seafood grill could be problematic).

The server was not overly warm/personable but acceptable initially. Things deteriorated quickly after I requested that my medium well steak be sent back. My son was already eating, and my second steak came back RAW inside and this set of frites were not crispy, they appeared to just be blanched in oil but were cooked through.

Upon her return, I told her I did not want to try again but this steak was raw inside. The response: "Your first steak was medium rare, we still have it in the back. You want it more rare and we give you what you want." I was gobsmacked! She basically told me I was wrong!

At no time was an apology issued although I did notice that a $10.00 discount was on my bill. It would have been nice for her to fall on her sword a bit (maybe mention the discount) in the name of customer service. I have generally enjoyed the food here previously but the service here could be improved!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
A hidden gem in our neighborhood. It's so nice to find a restaurant that has amazing quality and delicious food at great prices. Service was excellent as well.

I had the shrimp risotto and red snapper. My mouth is watering thinking about it.

If you go on a Monday and Wednesday night there are great wine deals as well!
author: Sunitha N.

description:
The food and atmosphere are really lovely and this is a overall an excellent value, but as others have said, the service has been lacking.  Every time I've been in the last few months, they always seem to be understaffed. Usually there's been only one server for the dining room, no matter how full it is, though there are other staff circling around who don't seem to be involved with service, or who are uninformed about the menu. When you ask for something, you get the: "I'll tell your server".   It's not clear who's in charge. On a recent visit, it seemed like everything went wrong and the server had a long-explained excuse for everything, including not automatically refilling the water.  Really? You were fined by the city??  
It's such a charming neighborhood gem, but this aspect should be addressed before it ruins its reputation.
author: John M.

description:
Knocking off a star Only because of the service. Empty tables and we still waited out in the cold with a reservation. Must have new employees as well because the waitress had made my bf's filet mignon into coal when we asked for medium well. But the chef even brought out the fixed order, so that was nice of him. thank you!! Otherwise, delish food! Great portions. Cozy quiet ambience. 

+ Calamari: 5/5
+ Filet: 5/5
+ Seafood Fettuccine: 5/5
author: Cristina C.

description:
I was first introduced to Alamo Square Seafood Grill over a year ago by friends who live in Burlingame and I've been a loyal fan and going here since. Once inside, we were immediately greeted by the charming and enthusiastic owner name Andre.  He was great with giving recommendations and helping us decide what wines pair nicely with our meals.  

Now let's talk about the food.  I have enjoyed EVERY meal since my first time here in 2013.  The food is cooked and presented beautifully, the meat is juicy and flavorful as are the side dishes.  If you're a fish lover, you will be hooked! The wine on the menu is also fantastic.  I have brought friends from out of state here and each of them have enjoyed their experience and meals.

The ambience, the service and of course the food is truly a well deserved 5 star. 

I just happen to be reading some yelpers complaining about their meals not being cooked to their liking.  I will say in my experience since getting to know Andre and his wonderful team as a regular this is something that could be remedied by simply taking the time to speak up and say something rather than leave unhappy and complain by blogging.  

Because of yelp reviews, I have been fortunate to make reservations at some wonderful restaurants all over the country.  I will say that Alamo Square Seafood Grill will be on your list too as a favorite place to enjoy a delicious meal and experience a wonderful service.  Take my word on it!
author: Aladdin N.

description:
Good food and charming environment. Took two stars off because, while one of the servers was exquisitely sweet and welcoming, the other was, in my experience, unwelcoming. 

 We were there Saturday, April 25.
author: SF R.

description:
We made a reservation to celebrate my birthday last week.
I was super excited with all these great yelp reviews about their food but after all, it was not a great idea to try out a totally new restaurant on a special day.

We showed up right on time. 
We opened the door and got in - and the first thing we noticed was we were not welcomed at all.
There were 2 waitresses but they *intentionally* avoided eye contacts (of course they knew we got it), until they were done with whatever they were doing. I thought it was odd to stand there intentionally unnoticed (not even simple greeting). Doesn't everyone say "I'll be right with you", or something like this, these days?
After a while, ok, we got seated.

Firstly, I could tell from their looks and faces that the 2 waitresses seemed so indifferent or they didn't want more customers. Maybe they are short staffed to serve that many people at the same time or just stressed out?

Secondly, considering the tiny place, there were just so many tables. You sit more closely to the strangers next tables than your company in front of you. You hear every single word people say on either side of you. They hear every single word you say. It was very uncomfortable. 

Next, noise level was high. If you'd prefer having a relaxing quiet dinner, it's not a place for you. 

We saw someone was not happy with the food so we thought something was going on.
At this point, we started thinking of leaving this place and going somewhere else. 
After a while (again!) someone came to the table to take orders but we could easily see that there were already so many people yet to be served, and we were not sure how long the wait would be until we get our food. We saw enough already and didn't want to ruin my birthday dinner, so we decided to leave.

It was unfortunate that we could not even have a chance to try their food but honestly it was quite shocking to see this kind of restaurant still exists. Overall the ambiance was unfriendly, cold and not welcoming. Needless to say, not a place you'd like to try on a special day. Or maybe we just picked a wrong place?
author: Mac K.

description:
I love seafood, and really love scallops!  This was a block away from where I was staying, so very convenient.
I got there around ~8 and as a single diner immediately got a small table.  The table are VERY close together which if I'd been trying to talk to a companion might have been weird but was fine for me.  The place was packed.
I got the seared scallops and they were OK.  They weren't fishy or undercooked, but I prefer a nice crispy outside (at least on the top) when they're supposed to be seared and these were SEASONED on top, and cooked, but not as much as I would like.  The asparagus was great (but only 4 spears) and the potatoes were, again, OK.
So I wasn't bummed, but wasn't wowed either.  Next time in the 'hood I'll try another place.
Oh, plus, I think they forgot my order in the kitchen so it took FOREVER (they comped me a glass of wine, which was a nice gesture)
author: Bobbi B.

description: Pretty terrible experience, we left before ordering.  Not sure if they were short-staffed that night, but hostess was not at all friendly. After acknowledging me a minute after I came in and asking for a moment, I stood there for several more minutes before finally she came over and I said we had an OpenTable reservation and she offered us table choice. I chose the only two-top not right by the door, but it needed cleaned off so she asked for a minute - no problem.  Another several minutes standing there, and I finally took one I didn't want as I figured that would be faster given how few staff there seemed to be and how slowly things were going.  Once my friend arrived, she brought menus and raced through the fish choices almost faster than we could even hear them, and left us to decide.  Came back to take our order, pretty distracted, and as we started ordering starters she asked for a minute and left us....several minutes of waiting later, put a sign on the door, came back to us to resume our order and oh, by the way, our credit card isn't working tonight so we're cash only. So we left.  Had even one aspect of the experience been positive or remotely friendly (even a slight attempt at a smile), I'd totally overlook the credit card machine being down - things happen - but I have zero intention of giving this a second try.  It's a pity, as it gets good reviews and we were in the mood for seafood that night.
author: Joe S.

description: We came for the first time on BYOB Wednesday and everything was fantastic! We ordered the mussels, tuna carpaccio, seared ahi tuna special and blackened trout. Everything was delicious. Service was good, they got pretty busy at some point and weren't as attentive. All in all, friendly faces and tasty food. We'll be back :)
author: Chauanh D.

description:
I can't count the times I walked past this place and wanted to try it but it went ignored on my for way too long. A close friend who lives near Alamo Square highly recommended it so it was time to try it. No regrets! It has been appropriately described by others as a gem.
The selection of fish and the freedom to choose how it's prepared and marinated is something you don't often see at other places. I tried the grilled Mahi Mahi with a french white wine sauce. AMAZING!
The service was great. We were the first customers there and it got busy fast so maybe shoot for getting there closer to 6pm.
The bread dipping sauce was also a great plus. I could pour that on anything and it would taste great.

One last tip: Wednesday nights you can bring your own bottle of wine without paying a corkage fee.
author: M R.

description: Saturday, March 11th for Birthday celebration.  Open Table reservation for 5:30pm.  Small eatery with loud music not fitting for French Fish place.  Food was not seasoned or overly salty.  Potato leek soup was good.  My seafood pasta dish was bland and I was served dead mussels...never opened in cooking.  Strange since they say they are a fish eatery.  A floating desert was nice.  Not sure if I will return.  I thought fixed 3 courses was priced well, but side dishes were very small portions.  Service was okay but strange at first since greeter, seater, and server/order taker was same person from 5:30-6pm. jmo
author: jerome m.

description: The food was delicious! Everything was cooked properly and the price for the prix fixe was perfect! The snapper was fall-apart-good and the sauce was the perfect amount. The cauliflower soup was the best my family and I ever had! And the ceviche was AMAZING, a must have if you want that light and refreshing appetizer. The only problem I had was the service. We had to ask for water everytime, repeat orders, and it felt like we had to wait a bit longer for our food than the other costumers (who were greeted properly and treated a bit better than me and my family, I believe). It kind of felt like we inconvenienced the staff by being there.
author: Le Le V.

description:
The two stars are for the food, and that is because the food itself was very good. It was the rest of the experience that was (sadly) dreadful. I brought my elderly mom here, who was visiting from outside the country for the Christmas holiday. She visits each year and I always make it a point to fit in one nice, special dinner out with her. I have a young toddler at home and work full time (both professionally and as a mom), so getting out to enjoy a nice, peaceful meal, is these days an event for me too. Something I look forward to. It is also a chance to do something nice for my own mom. 
So, we researched several restaurants before deciding upon this one due to it's location, it's seafood menu, and it didn't appear too trendy or pretentious... perfect!
We were greeted by (who I now determine is) the owner, and were seated promptly - good start. It was a Wednesday, with a waived corkage fee so that was nice, and we brought along a couple bottles of wine to enjoy with dinner.
Once seated, the service went totally downhill. Our waitress, after taking our order, basically ignored us (or forgot we were there?). We did order a calamari appetizer, and that arrived rather promptly, so that was nice. But then, we actually sat and watched as our fellow diners arrived, ordered, got their food and paid/left, and we still had not gotten our entrees. That might be fine with a single table, but this trend surrounded us. And it started to feel like we were being actively ignored. It was strange. I've worked in the service industry, and if you screw something up, or have some sort of delay, just tell the table, apologize, maybe give a smile... we got none of that. At one point, my mom and I gestured to the first person who sort of made eye contact with us, the owner, I believe... my mom then started to ask for clarification about who our waitperson was, and I think this just made him impatient. So, I just jumped in and said, 'could we just get some more lemon and water?' and he left, presumably to help us out there. We eventually got the lemon (for our now cold, rubbery calamari - it was tasty at first- we just wanted a bit more lemon!), but no water refill, until later when I asked someone else for water refills. So, at one point, my mom, sort of waived her hands (a little animatedly, I'll admit), as she'd lost patience waiting for our entrees. It was an expeditor (or bus person- not sure) who came over, and asked us to repeat what we'd ordered and that she'd go check on it for us. It was not long after that that our entrees were delivered, not by our waitress, by the person who asked us to confirm what we'd ordered. We liked the menu so much that we'd ordered 3 entrees- scallops with a risotto, poached trout and the sole in a buerre blanc sauce. All of them were really good. Well prepared, nicely portioned, just lovely. But nobody came to ask how we were doing, we ran out of water again, but screw it, just let that go... we had to ask for the bill (no offer of dessert, as other tables received). 
My mom lives in Mexico and dines out often with a girlfriend of hers, She says that she believes two women dining together (or a group of women) get treated like second class citizens just because they are women, and/or because there is some supposition that they will not tip well. I cannot say I agree with this, but given my mom's 70+ years on the planet, and the experience the other night, I'm giving that theory some further consideration. And that's depressing. I tip well (especially well for good or exemplary service), and I always tip baristas, the folks ringing my food up at downtown lunch counters... And so do the other women I know, so there - got that off my chest.
Now, here's the final, and really most bizarre, thing that happened that night at this place. We'd already exited the restaurant, and we see this man leap outside the door and scream 'BYEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!'. It startled my mother, who almost lost her footing and fell. It was the owner. He deemed it necessary to sarcastically scream goodbye to us. It was not a friendly gesture, make no mistake - it was hostile and obnoxious. And after that, I just felt f**king perplexed and angry. What a low life thing to do. I can only imagine that he perceived us to be high maintenance (this is a total guess, since I'm not a mind reader and don't really care), but at what point is us advocating for ourselves to find out where our food is and ask for water because we were thirsty, cause to treat us with such hostility? We went into the experience in good spirits, we are both kind people, not entitled, but we were forced to advocate for ourselves to get anything at all to happen for our table. And quite simply, we were paying customers. Terrible way to treat one's customers. Obviously will never go back, and proactively dissuade my friends and colleagues from doing so.
author: Kristen R.

description: A small, charming, surprisingly affordable fish-centric spot near Alamo square. We ordered a few things including the mussels meuniere, the salmon (rare, blackened with beurre blanc - definitely our favorite sauce!), a couple glasses of wine (the house sauvignon blanc was our fav) and the chocolate cake. The big winner though, was the utterly delicious free bread and pesto they brought out at the beginning of the meal.  Go score some of that!
author: Aaron M.

description: This place has such a lovely, inviting atmosphere. Ample pillows and candlelight give off a warm glow that is perfect for a relaxed dinner at the end of a stormy day. If you're in a rush, this isn't the place for you. They have slow, but thoughtful service, and the dishes are meticulously crafted. The seafood here is fragrant and light, and they have a small seasonal menu. Great for a romantic dinner, and to top it off the prices ($14.50 for a 3-course dinner) are worth a regular visit.
author: Christine K.

description:
Pros:
-Yummy tiramisu for dessert!
-Healthy options on the menu, had the grilled Red Snapper
- Cute ambiance 

Cons:
- Rice served with fish was bland and boring
-They served us coffee without a spoon or creamer. Had to ask for it and then had to wait 5 minutes. By the time it came, coffee was cold. So annoying.
-They only carry sweet n low and sugar (bring your own Splenda or Equal)

Overall, descent restaurant with good quality food. However it was not a 'wow' San Francisco restaurant. Service was just okay.
author: Tennis Q.

description:
Where to begin with this place:

I had a reservation (made via Google+) for 2 for 9 PM on 4/16. Walked in and saw there was a table available (two small tables pushed together) in the corner, but was told by a waitress that she wasn't exactly sure when she could seat us, and that we couldn't be seated and that the table was for a party of 4. She also explained that there were parties who'd been sitting and talking for 20+ mins. after eating and paying, to which I suggested she kindly tell them that a party with a reservation is waiting to be seated (she refused). Then I reiterated that we had a 9 PM reservation because we were in a hurry and had an event at 10 PM, to which she said, "Then maybe you should've made a reservation for 8:30 PM." (So, needless to say, she was terribly rude). I wanted to leave and find another place to eat, but doing so after 9 PM in San Francisco when you have a show coming up is practically impossible.

My friend and I finally got seated after 9 PM (they took my suggestion of separating the two free small tables, but not before denying us that table). We ordered the grilled rib eye, medium rare. Worst steak I've ever had. I've never had a steak with so much fat on it, and the pommes frites were soaked in oil. I should've stuck to my gut - any steak in this city below $20 is probably a bad steak. In addition, every time the waitress needed to get past my friend, she would use her hip to push past his elbow several times, without even saying "excuse me."

Given how bad the food was, and how rude the waitress was, I left no tip (my friend left a decent tip - he arrived right after the argument with the waitress). We were on our way to our show when the waitress used my number from my reservation to call and complain that I left no tip and tried to explain that they did their best to accommodate my friend and me. When I attempted to speak on the phone, she interrupted me and talked over me during the entire call. The fact that she even called my number crossed the line, because it's obvious that she wouldn't have called me if I had left a tip. Never going there again, needless to say.
author: Uche I.

description:
This is what I appreciate about Yelp. I was trying to figure out someplace to dine Wednesday night and Alamo Square Grill was mentioned in a talk thread. 2 hours later I'm there. I called ahead and they were not put off at all by a table for one.

I had the celery root soup to start and duck as my entree. Both were superior. Especially I liked the spinach with the main. The wine recommendation was perfect as was the service. I really appreciate it when the menu is small. It usually means the few things are fresh and well prepared. 

It has a real bistro feel about it. God I'd dine here a lot if I lived anywhere close.
author: J T.

description: I don't get the average on this one - this was not good.  Beef stew was like Dinty Moore, nothing against her.  Partner's chicken was not edible - overcooked to the point of like eating wood.  Almost all foreign tourists (thanks for coming to San Francisco), probably guided by a concierge or trying to save a buck.  Not worth it, don't do it.  Out of the three hundred plus San Francisco restaurants on my list - this is at the bottom.  Sorry
author: Glenn S.

description:
I have been looking for a good seafood restaurant in the city that is not exorbitantly expensive.  Found it!

Alamo Square Seafood Grill was a great little spot. The atmosphere is classy with candle-lit tables, and the food is really good.  

It is hard to beat the prix fixe menu at 14.50. It comes with soup or salad, a fish entree (served with rice and vegetables), and a dessert. The fish was excellently seasoned and came with a great sauce.  Complimentary bread with a pesto sauce is also offered, and it is AWESOME.  

The service is European.  They aren't trying to turn tables as quickly as possible.  There are a few minutes between each of the courses.  So if you are trying to grab a quick bite before a show or something, this is not your place.  If you want to enjoy dinner with your SO or catch up with a friend, this is a great place to relax together and then take a stroll around Alamo Square to see the Painted Lady houses. 

I highly recommend it, and I'll be back for sure.
author: Emily G.

description:
Back in town and had to return to this little gem. Still a delight. Thanks Yelpers for reminding me that Wednesdays you can bring your own bottle of vino.
 Armed with a Casa Nuestra Chenin Blanc we returned. and were warmly greeted by Andre. This time I had the blackened snapper with green peppercorn sauce. Fabulous. Wife had grilled salmon with a buerre blanc sauce. Loved it. How can you beat dinner for twowith your own bottle of wine for $32? As we departed Andre followed us out the door to ask about our experience and chat for a while. Told him would would return on our next visit to the city.
Tip to Yelpers visiting SF: get off the Wharf and away from Union Square and seek out restaurants in one of the many neighborhoods in the city. From the Mission to Noe to the Castro to Hayes Valley there are numerious family run places that are much easier on the wallet and offer fabulous cuisine!
author: Joe M.

description: Took the staff to Alamo Square Seafood Grill last night for our Christmas party.  Had a wonderful time.   The food was very good and very reasonably priced.  The 1/2 price wine on Mondays was a great bargain and put us in the right frame of mind to enjoy our party.  The service was superb and the seating accomodated our party of 15 very well.   I will definitely be back.   I have to try the Wednesday no corkage fee day.
author: Jerry O.

description:
I don't know why I didn't give this amazing gem 5 stars! 

I just went back recently on a date and the food could not have been more delicious. 

Are you still unsure? 

Factoid #1: I know a guy who has lived in the Lower Haight for 5 years who proposed to his gf here. 

Factoid #2: This restaurant is rated the BEST DEAL in the entire BAY AREA. Aka, you won't pay nearly as much moola for the amazing seafood. 

In summary, this place is romantic, affordable, and completely worth checking out.
author: Kathryn D.

description:
My overall rating for this restaurant is really just so so, nothing to write home about.     It's good value if you're looking for a bargain.    They have the Fix-Prix menu for only 14.95 and you get a salad,  salmon with some carrots and a little rice and the white part of a lemon meringue pie.  They call that a dessert.     Do you enjoy just the white part of a lemon Meringue pie?   We also had the crab cake.   It lacked the texture a good crab cake should have.   
The salad was not that fresh.  It's like the mixed greens you have in  the fridge after it's been in there a week or two.   The salmon was actually decent.   I ate all of it.   

I don't think I'll return.
author: Doris A.

description:
What a great little restaurant
We went for a birthday party of 7 and we were treated like kings by Andre the owner.
All the dishes were wonderful, especially the crab cakes, the mahi mahi , the red snapper and the bay scallops. Yes you can order the way it is cooked, and the sauce to go with it. Andre will tell you if it is a good combination ( and yes  he does tell you if there is a better one !) . Desert were delicious as well like the creme brulée and the flowerless chocolate fondant . And when you bring your own wine free of corkage fee on wednesday night, Andre will insist on getting a taste with you ( might be a south of France custom !) . The atmosphere is great also for romantic dinners and I 'm sure I will come back with my significant other numerous time from now on
author: Frank W.

description:
My date arrived 15 minutes late and 15 minutes before they closed. The hostess was still very humble while I ripped him a new one due to how freaking rude that is. 

Wasting my time, fine. I ordered my food & my wine and enjoyed a lovely meal while waiting patiently for him to come take care of the bill ;) . Extending the time somebody has to be at work, because you're a jackass with no common courtesy, unacceptable.

She had good recommendations and I devoured some really amazing mussels with chorizo. Will def be back to try out some other stuff.
author: J A.

description:
We just happened upon this place, and it's a hidden neighborhood gem.   Delicious food, good portions, great service and reasonable prices.   Not fancy, but they do have escargot.

We will definitely be going back to this one.
author: Whitney D.

description: Cozy, non pretentious atmosphere with friendly adorable wait staff.  The food is excellently prepared , with love and obvious attention.  The wine is delicious and they always have specials.  Plus come on Wednesday with ur own wine= no corkage fee.  Get the floating meringue dessert.  Wow.
author: T L.

description:
Amazing, it was so delicious! I had the grilled beurre mâitre D'Hotel salmon absolutely scrumptious. My roommate got the grilled bearnaise swordfish, again, perfection. Both pieces were grilled seamlessly. . . Also the crispy calamari is mouth watering. 
Only downside is the water glasses are small and the waitress came back to refill our table maybe 7 times. Otherwise, definitely loved the meal! : )

I'll totally be back!
author: Erin W.

description: The main reason for my 1-star review is that we had a reservation for our anniversary, but we left after being treated very rudely by the woman working the front-of-house. We arrived on time for our 7 pm OpenTable reservation on Aug 28 but had to wait because the only table they set aside for us was a table right in the doorway. She had us wait outside. A table in the window was vacated within a few minutes but it wasn't cleared for 10 minutes. It was 15 minutes past our reservation timeslot, so my partner walked inside and asked the server if he could clear the table so we could be seated (it was a little chilly outside). The woman working front-of-house got in my partner's face and angrily said the server was doing his job and said, "I told you to wait outside." I went inside after the incident to tell her we were going elsewhere for dinner due to her rudeness, and she got defensive and started justifying her behavior because the restaurant was "so busy." Seriously? I can accept needing to wait 10 minutes for a table, but treating us rudely and then defending that behavior is absolutely unacceptable. That woman needs to keep her anger and self-righteousness in check. It was the worst service and treatment we had ever received in a restaurant. We definitely won't be going back. Don't waste your time and money. There are plenty of other better places to eat in the city. We ended up going to The Boxing Room instead and had a wonderful dinner with excellent service.
author: Gina I.

description: I honestly haven't been to such a cute/quaint/adorable little seafood spot in a while. I went here for my birthday and it was fabulous! I had mussels to start and then the beurre blanc poached sole (I think thats what is was)! Anyways the staff/waiters were so accommodating and friendly ! I would highly recommend this restaurant! Also reasonable prices too, considering how much wine we ordered!
author: callan w.

description:
I had the field greens and sauteed mahi mahi with beurre maitre d'hotel, and my partner had the butter lettuce salad with grilled salmon with bernaise, and we err both happily satisfied . . . until w had the floating island, and then we were sublimely satisfied!  Thank you for a lovely dinner!

Oh, one thing, since I'm still waiting for the check . . . how much was that fish?  Oh!  $15.95?  That's great!  I'm adding a star just for that!
author: SuzAnne W.

description: Our server Julia was absolutely fabulous. She was very helpful with the menu and the wines, she suggested wonderful choices off the specials list and delicious desserts it's always a pleasure to come here but tonight's experience was particularly fun. Thank you Julia and all the awesome cooks!
author: Trevor F.

description:
My wife and I went tonight and overall the service was quite slow. Not sure if it was understaffed service team or the kitchen, but it took nearly an hour just to get our calamari appetizers out.

Overall the food was good for the price, but the food serving time was inconsistent from table to table and I was over it by the time we could pay the bill.
author: Travis L.

description:
Last week, my wife and I decided to try Alamo Square Seafood Grill.
We are always looking for a cozy restaurant with good food at a reasonable price.

Glad to say that we were quite pleased.  The service was good and friendly (always
very important), and the food was delicious.
We started with the spinach salad with pears along with the crab cakes.
My wife had the Mediterranean fish soup and I took the rib-eye steak. 
Everything was cooked to perfection and more importantly, timed just right.
We shared a bottle of red wine- Nuit St. Georges, Bourgogne and finished 
with an espresso.
So, to sum it up, great food, good and friendly service, in a cozy atmosphere at a reasonable price.
So glad to have discovered this restaurant. We will be back soon!

Greg
author: Gregory S.

description: Unbelieveably good seafood! The shrimp risotto and scallops where great. Super value!
author: Wiljami S.

description:
I love seafood. But this place is not my cup of tea. 
My friend, his sister and I came here for dinner. First off, slightly overpriced (And I'm from New York! Where the word Overpriced was invented !!!!) 
Lovely ambiance and my waitress was nice. She helped us with recommendations. Choices were hard coz I don't usually like fish. So I had the crab cakes dinner.
My friend had the steak dinner and his sister the chicken. Umm... okkkkk .. I did not like the rice. I felt it was a lil but under cooked. The crab cakes were delicious. I always love crab cakes so I'm picky about how it tastes.  Pomme frites with steak! Are you serious!!!!! Just call it French Fries man!! God! My friend liked her chicken so that was good.
Trying this place once was alright. Not worth a second time.
author: Sara S.

description:
My girlfriend and I came for date night and we were seated right away. The service is very good, the bus girl was very friendly as well. Half priced wine night on Tuesday, how could you go wrong.

Calamari was good, crab cake was OK. My steak was decent, I wouldn't get it again. But the tuna special my gf got was perfect. I'd get that next time for sure.
author: Joey M.

description: Absolutely loved this place. Food was excellent, server was super nice and the place is really cute. We loved the mussels!
author: Domitilla D.

description: This is a hidden gem in the city, high quality food without the ridiculous prices. I brought a friend visiting from out of town for her birthday dinner and we loved this place. It is cozy, intimate, and the hostess/server was extremely sociable. We had the calamari for appetizer, I got the rare seared tuna of the day and my friend got the shrimp with spinach risotto. All dishes were excellent. To end the meal we shared dessert which they brought with a candle, it was to die for! It was the floating island with toasted almonds, very light and flavorful. All in all a great experience, highly recommend!
author: Sanji C.

description:
We brought a friend from out of town and given the generally positive reviews, we were pretty disappointed.  The fish entrees were very nice but most of the other dishes were "meh".  And while the service we friendly our waitress seemed totally lost.  See more below: 

PROS:
* We all ordered fish (Snapper or Trout) in different preparations.  The fish was fresh, flavorful and well prepared.   
* The staff are universally friendly and welcoming 
* They are not aggressive turning the tables - we weren't rushed to leave (although we did eventually have trouble getting someone's attention to get the check). 

CONS:
* SALAD - One of us ordered a salad without dressing but all the salads came undressed.  When we asked the waitress she insisted they were dressed and we had a little debate as we took bites and tried to detect flavor.  Eventually we asked for a little dressing on the side and she brought out (literally) about a tablespoon of dressing for two people to share.  
* APPETIZERS: We had the crab cakes and shrimp ceviche to start.  The ceviche isn't really ceviche (its more like cooked shrimp with avocado and spices) but it was good.  The crab cakes were super disappointing - they were undercooked and and the crab got a little lost in the filler.
* DESSERT: One of us had the prix fixe which came with dessert.  There was no choice - you got "Floating Island" (meringue on a puddle of custard) with the Prix Fixe.  It was strangely flavorless - not worth the calories. 

SERVICE: 
The service was just weird.  We were seated by a classy professional waiter who helped us pick a nice bottle of wine and took our orders.  Then he was gone. From then on we had this very sweet waitress who seemed utterly lost.  First we had the salad debate with her.  Then when the entrees came she had no idea who ordered what OR what the dishes in her hand were (we helped her guess).  When dessert time came she pulled out a crumpled sheet of paper and read aloud.  When we reminded her that one of us had the prix fixe she said "oh!" and walked away.  We assumed (correctly) that meant no dessert choice. She didn't ask if anyone else wanted anything.  

Net-net - not awful but we regretted our choice and see no reason to go back.
author: David K.

description: Love this place. Come here all the time. Everything is good, especially the fish. The swordfish they used to have is my sweetie's favorite. They rarely have it any more, but the other things are so good we keep coming back. Check it out!
author: Lieva W.

description: Alamo Square Grill is our go-to for a great weekday dinner where you get quality SF cuisine without the pretension or price-gouging. The food is consistently great and we know we can count on excellent service every time. If you go on a Friday, you'll get to meet the owner Andre. He is as special as the place! The kitchen can always accommodate me as a vegetarian and my husband says their beef bourguignon is not to be missed. I recently recommended it to a co-worker, who told me it was one of his favorite places too! We were raving together, so I wanted to make sure to write this review. For a warm, cozy neighborhood spot you won't be disappointed.
author: no n.

description:
if you haven't been to alamo square seafood grill, YOU ARE MISSING OUT! my favorite dishes are the mussels (both the meuniere and chorizo sauce are delicious!) and the petrale sole (fish specials vary daily) sauteed with the beurre blanc sauce. my fish is always cooked just right and the sauce perfectly complements the fish.

no corkage on wednesday - so BYOB! the staff is very friendly (we're regulars and they always remember us), food is excellent and the prices are more than reasonable!
author: Jae C.

description:
Great Food. If you are a seafood lover, you need to try this place. 

Good Fish, great prep, friendly servers, reasonable cork fee, and reasonably priced.

In a city of many food choices, which can turn out terribly bad, I can tell you that I will definitely be adding Alamo Square Seafood Grill  to my "go to" sf spots.
author: Scott G.

description:
... perhaps the best little neighborhood restaurant in the city ... simple concept and perfect execution ...

... 4 types of fresh fish (usually a salmon, mahi mahi, rainbow trout, and sea bass) brought in daily -- 4 different preparations -- and 4 different sauces ... mix and match to your heart's delight ... served with beautifully prepared steamed rice and vegetables ... 

... recommended starter = the trout salad ... recommended dessert = the flour-less chocolate cake ...

... simple, but extremely well thought out global wine list priced to drink (averaging ~ $40) ...

Deliciousness abounds, but one of the main reasons to go is the exceptional, fluid, and comforting service you get from Ken ... almost always there, and always a pleasure to be served by ... 

... and if that's not enough, the weekday prix fixe menu (5:30-7 pm) is almost unheard of ... soup or salad (generously portioned), a fish course of the chef's choosing, and dessert for only $14.50 ... Shut your trapper keeper! 

... Mondays = Half off of the entire wine list ...
... Wednesdays = No corkage fee ...

... What's not to Love?
author: Asha P.

description: The atmosphere was pure SF neighborhood cozy. The hostess and server were personal and attentive. The portions were wonderfully prepared and just the right size and at a very fair price. We enjoyed the potato leek soup, the poached pear salad, the seared Ahi in red pepper sauce and the shrimp risotto.
author: Barrett B.

description:
A lovely little neighborhood restaurant. My mom and I had the boeuf bourguignon, one of the four specials that night--lovely! Everyone else had seafood of some sort, which was all prepared well and very tasty. And very reasonably priced for seafood in the City.
And yes--this was our first time dining here. My husband had researched on Yelp, and found this listed as a neighborhood gem.  My parents and uncle hadn't been to this area in years, and we all loved walking a couple blocks and seeing City Hall lit up for the holidays peeking through the cross streets!
author: V J.

description:
I used to work in the neighborhood and this place was on my list to try. My husband and I finally came in a few months ago for dinner. It's a small place so we made reservations. We stood awkwardly around for about 10 minutes before anybody even acknowledged us. 
Looking back we probably should have left then. Service was very slow from the drinks to the food to the check. Normally this wouldn't have been so bad, but we had plans after. 
They were out of what I had originally ordered which was annoying. They do have a nice selection of wines. This was probably the only highlight of the visit.
The food really left me wanting more. Very bland and disappointing. The whole experience was very meh. 
Overall there are a ton of cozy and tasty neighborhood gems and unfortunately this just isn't one of them.
author: Michelle T.

description: One of the best places i have been in awhile! I dine out 4/5 nights a week and am ecstatic to have found this gem.
author: John C.

description:
This place has such potential--the wonderful prix fixe menu--the half off bottle nights...So why the negative review? 

Each time I've been here..I've been extremely frustrated with the service. It always appears that they have one server-one busser for the entire restaruant. That's a stretch even for a small restauarant. Last night we went there with another couple. During our dinner there were only a few other tables seated. It took quite some time for our friend to get his first beer. They brought out our friends appetizer but we didn't get ours until about 10 minutes later.  That was the theme to our entire dinner.

We had great company--decent food..which makes up for the lack of service...but I am not sure if I will hurry back....
author: Mimi T.

description: We got a table for 6 here without too much trouble and had a great time. Our servers Susie and Christian were very accommodating and the ambiance was down to earth but still a little fancy. Prices are very reasonable for seafood.  A few of us had the $16.00 prix fixe specials, which we were happy with. The trout in provencale sauce was great and so was the mussel appetizer.
author: Dan C.

description:
Simple, chill, laid back, cozy w/the wall mounted bench seating and chunky colorful pillows. Vibe was good, fish was fresh, even the pork entree was succulent, tender and tasty. No table turning rush.

Minus a star (and a half) for the super squashed floor pattern--if we were there on a busy night, I can't imagine--the dirty water glass the BF got--the lipstick print on my after dinner coffee cup--and the many bones found in the trout entree. Wish I could give it a 3.5.
author: M M.

description: I love the mussels here, need more bread to dip in the broth, it's that dericious! Staff is friendly and nice too.
author: Pickle R.

description:
I go here with my wife for the last 3 years.
Very friendly service and cosy atmosphere.

Love the creme brulee and the escargot. Also the fish menu is pretty good.
author: Karlos H.

description: Walked in, was hot, muggy and smelled like butt. Suprised with the reviews. My wife and I immediately turned around after making the same expression.
author: Connor T.

description:
Okay.... so we had a reservation, and got there 10 minutes early.  10 minutes later when our reservation was ready, we did sit down, however it took our server 25 minutes after we sat down to even come over to us, give us menus, or water, or even really acknowledge our presence :(  That was sad.  
The food was okay.  My fiancé's entree (look at that rhyme) was quite tasty, but mine was unusual.... I ordered the scallops, because with a scallop on the menu, I figure, you just have to get it.  Because, come on!  Scallops!
However, they tasted metallic and sour.  every single one of them!  Oh dear.  As if they had gone off.  The sauce didn't taste like that, the actual meat of the scallops tasted like that.
I think, when you go to a seafood place you have to ask when they caught the scallops.  A day-boat scallop is the thing to have.  This is what I have experienced.  The day-boat scallop is something they catch that day, super early, out on the boat, then they bring it in and cook it in the place that night.  It has to be from that very morning.  I don't think those scallops were caught that morning.  
Lesson learned.  I think our appetizers were good and his dinner was good but service was dismal the entire time and my scallops were weird.  I won't probably be going back.
author: Gillian K.

description: Had reservations. Arrived promptly. I chose prix fixe, my companion, steak. Entree arrived one hour after we did. No apologies from wait staff. Owner finally said, "You know, it's steak. We had to find a piece of meat, and the chef is a little bit of a madman. Haha." Fish tasted not recently caught. Dirty plates remained on table for a good 15 minutes. We had calculated that arriving on time would get us to Civic center, with car parked, in time for a 7:30 curtain. Had to ask for check to be brought with dessert to go. To go container was from a Chinese restaurant, a deep container with red calligraphy on front. No utensil. When I flagged down the waitperson to  ask for a plastic spoon, she said they didn't have any and brought a metal one instead. ("Just throw it away--we have plenty.") Companion's late-arriving steak was fine, he said, but not fine enough to compensate for tension of absence of waitperson from floor or her explaining the delays, or hunger, or worry about making 7:30 curtain. We will try to forget this restaurant;  you might want to as well.
author: Toba S.

description: Bof !! The fish was good but the sauce very poor as the sides!  It's not a good restaurant...and when you book for a given time they make you wait, we had to come back 30min later.
author: Marie Charlotte D.

description:
Alamo Square Seafood Grill is one of the most underrated establishments in town as well as my favorite local restaurant for the past several years.  I'm constantly recommending the place and figured it was time to write this well deserved long overdue review. 

The overall atmosphere is unpretentious yet inviting. I love to take friends or family visiting from out of town as it is lively but intimate, celebrate special occasions or simply catch up with friends over a well-prepared French specialty paired with an equally appropriate and reasonably priced wine selection.  

The service is exceptional!  Ken (the only server) is attentive, animated but very professional, and quick while precise.  If you've been there at least a few times, he'll address you by name, remember what you ordered and even where you sat the previous time.  He pretty much runs the show and does it with style and grace, which filters through the rest of the staff and the guests. 

I highly recommend ASSG (at the risk of ruining the cozy feel that characterizes it), especially on " 1/2 off wine Mondays", and "BYOW-no-corkage fee Wednesdays".  I'm addicted to their chorizo steamed mussels and particularly fond of their crème brûlée. Do yourself a favor: skip the crowded tourist traps and try this neighborhood gem.
author: Monica V.

description: Love this place! The location is great and the wait staff was just amazing. Sole blackened definitely made my night. I urge you to come try.
author: Josh M.

description: Alamo Square Seafood Grill is probably my favorite eating place in all of San Francisco. I had the mixed greens salad with sautéed sole with a beurre blanc sauce. Both items were great. The service was good, and the location was great. I would definitely come back.
author: Jake M.

description: Found this charming little seafood place while searching for something else. We thought sure why not. We didn't have a reservation but they found us a table anyways. It was cozy and comfortable in the corner. The fish preparation and options were fun. We will come back again and mix it up next time. The service was friendly and the prices were reasonable and saving for last it all looked and tasted great. We even opted for an upside down apple pie and it too good although the ice cream scoop was infant sized but maybe you did us a favor. We will return again.
author: Stephen L.

description:
4.5 stars:
- Great value / reasonable prices
- Delicious food
- Fancy, but not pretentious and very tolerating

My friends and I dropped by Alamo Square Seafood Grill on the way to a Halloween house party and we had a great meal.   Despite being a relatively nice place, they had no problem with five already-drunk party goers dressed in full costumes.  

Per the server's recommendation, we all had one of the fish specialties.  I let them customize mine completely based on a description of what type of fish I like and they did a great job!  

We also enjoyed a delicious salad that I don't see on the menu anymore, and I believe a tomato and fresh mozzarella appetizer.      We had a delicious and very reasonably priced bottle of Gewürztraminer - delicious with the light fish, albeit a bit sweet.

This place is very well priced - a three course meal is only $14.50 between 5:30 and 7pm, plenty of great bottles of wine for under $40, etc.

Highly recommend!
author: Greg B.

description:
When prices are reasonable, I do not expect perfection, and as a big fan of reasonably priced food, I loved this little neighborhood restaurant.  Service was friendly and accommodating.  They even provided a free sample size soup as a starter.  I really enjoyed not just their fish, but freshness of their seasonable vegetables.  Nicely executed.  I'll need to try this place several more times before giving it 5 stars. 

PRE-FIXE:  $12.50 Three-Course meal.  No choices other than soup or salad.  Ok, great deal, but rules are not simple.  (See picture of the rule on the menu). Rule reads:  Available 5:30-6:30pm Fri and Sat and all night Sun-Thur.  Not valid with Wed no corkage or for tables of four or more.  Sounds confusing?

REGULAR DISHES:  Don't feel like you lose out when you order regular dishes which may cost as much or more than 3-course pre-fixe, because portion size is much bigger than the main dish you get in the pre-fixe.    

PARKING:  Street parking isn't too difficult if you don't mind walking couple of blocks up a hill.
author: トモ T.

description: This place is a genuine neighborhood gem. Their prix fixe from 530-7pm is fantastic, a good amount of well-prepared food at an excellent price. Nothing crazy fancy, but sometimes I just want a nice meal that isn't infused or inspired, and come on... Three courses for $15 in this town is a steal. Come eat here!
author: Bo M.

description:
The food here is excellent and worthy of 5 stars but the service is extremely slow and cold, dragging this place down.

I've been here twice, both on Saturday nights. First was for a reservation at 5:30pm, with plans for the ballet later. We were seated promptly and appetizers were great. We waited patiently for our entree as customers that came in after us finished and left. Since we were headed to the ballet, we got antsy and asked. Waitress let us know they had screwed up our order and were re-cooking it. The food came out 2 minutes later, so they certainly could have told us much sooner. Worst part was no word of apology. We ended up having to deal with the check as we hurried through what turned out to be delicious entrees.

We decided to give the place another try based on the food, with 7:30 reservation and no plans afterwards. We were made to wait outside for 20 minutes before being seated. In the meantime, 2 other groups were also being made to wait, also with reservations.

Despite not having any hiccups this time, total meal time came to two hours and 15 minutes with dessert. This is just far too slow, even as patient and laid back as we are. Other groups were clearly less pleased. Despite noting during the reservation that it was my wife's birthday, not one word of this was noted by the server.
The kicker was for the table next to us, the food was brought out (for 3/4 of them, there was a screw up with the 4th) and were told "Bon Appetite", but the server had to be called back to be scolded that they had no silverware.

We get a cold, impersonal vibe from the server both times, and while the busser is warmer, she has a thick accent making it really hard to understand what she's saying. Neither ever come by to ask how things are.

I want to like this place because the food is good and the intimate atmosphere is nice. But the service is just poor. Or maybe they are undermanned and need a third person. Either way it's really a shame about the service.
author: H M.

description: We go to this place for special occasions and love it. It's got great ambiance and unfailingly delicious food. The fish is very good, but so is everything on their daily menus. We seem to always end up ordering off of the daily menu. Their soup is really worth getting -- really fresh and made with fragrant herbs. Their bread and the spicy pesto dip that comes with it is so tempting. You will want to keep eating it until it's gone and then dinner arrives and you're full. Not that I don't eat the dinner anyway. A great place!
author: Sharon G.

description:
I have seen this place  while riding the 22 numerous times and literally made mental bookmarks to "try it".

So 4 years go by (I'm totally a procrastinator) and I FINALLY decide to get my act together and pick a place for a sweet birthday dinner and date with one of  my best friends. ASSG got us out of our respective neighborhoods to try something new and we were not disappointed!

Alamo Square is quaint, casual and had one of the best seafood stews I have had. It was chock full of mussels, salmon, trout and scallops in a full flavored tomato based broth. 

Miss B had the chicken which looked equally tasty and if I wasn't trying to watch my love handles I would have asked for a third round of bread! The bread was fresh and the herb dipping oil was amazing with a little spicy kick.

To top it off, the waiter brought my birthday creme brulee with a candle and called me darlin' which made me smile (the creme brulee? delicious as well).

They had a decent selection of wine and with the specials they have of half bottles on Mondays and no corkage on Wednesdays this place is a steal! Plus a Prix Fixe menu for $15!

I didn't find the service to be negative in the least! It was a little slow but then again, our waiter was great and didn't hover like at some places and would glance over to make sure we were ok,. He promptly brought our check when he noticed we were done with our meal. He was friendly, helpful and provided great service with a smile which is a lot more than other places in the city. 

I am happy I tried ASSG and definitely recommend it for seafood lovers who want well made food in a relaxed atmosphere.
author: Kathy K.

description: Had a wonderful experience. Alice, who was serving our table, was very kind and friendly, the food was great, and the atmosphere was perfect for dinner.
author: Ben W.

description: Everything is really good! One of the best values I've run across in the city. Great food, great service and atmosphere. The escargot was tender and flavorful and the seared ahi was perfect accompanied bt grilled corn and portobello mushrooms, yum!
author: John M.

description:
What an awful experience Wednesday night. My folks decided to take my wife and I out to a post-War Horse dinner. Having been to the restaurant before, my parents had nothing but good things to say: cute place, quiet, good food, etc.  As a frequent restaurant goer, I was excited to try this place. Sooooo disappointing. 

The service was absolutely terrible. First, they forgot to bring us an appetizer we ordered, and then said we didn't order it (how about, "I'm sorry"?!).  We were having a nice time being out as a family, so this was not too big of a deal. Time for the main courses.  Tick tock, tick tock (getting hungrier), more time passes (getting grumpy), another 5 minutes (getting pissed). During this 30 minutes of post (partial) appetizer eating, no one came to the table to explain what was going on and/or apologize. More water? Ha, good luck. When we arrived there were three tables occupied, so it wasn't like they were too busy.  Finally, the meals arrive. Well, 3 of the 4 meals. "we forgot to order one of your entrees, we'll get it out in a few minutes" (no apology).  Another 20+ minutes passes and everyone is finished with their meal when entree #4 arrives. Ridiculous. 

Sometimes places have a bad night, which I understand. What boggles my mind is how you can be so unapologetic and nonchalant about the diners' experience.  We asked to speak with the owner, who came over and says "there was a human error, that's all I can say."  when asked why he hasn't come over to apologize during the wait time, he says "I did not want to step on the toes of my server". You've got to be freaking kidding me. "I can offer you a free dessert". Seriously? Safe to say I will never return.  There are many great restaurants in SF, and there is no need to waste an evening at a place that has such a lack of interest in service.
author: Bob D.

description: Food was good, but the service we got was super slow because there was only one woman working as a server and a hostess .. Shouldn't take more than an hour to get our food.
author: Thalia H.

description:
Two friends & I showed up here on a Wednesday night not knowing that we should have made a reservation ahead of time. It was BYOB night, so we were really excited to get a bunch of seafood with the wine we brought. But.. it was totally full when we got there. We sat outside trying to make a plan for a few minutes, and the owner (Andre I think) came out and said he had made room at a table for us! It was the nicest thing.. we were really appreciative and excited to be able to eat there. 

Not only was he nice & accommodating, but the food was DELICIOUS. I mean, the best salmon dish I've ever had. We got 3 appetizers, 2 entrees, and a dessert. The 3 of us split the bill evenly and it was only about $30 each! Definitely coming back :)
author: Tierney S.

description:
This place deserves more cred. than given! 

Came here for my grandma's birthday dinner with the fam, and we were all more than stuffed, satisfied, and happy that a three-course meal for everyone didn't break the bank!


FOOD HIGHLIGHTS:
================
 --- soup of the day: curry zucchini 

 ---  mussels with chorizo and tomato cream sauce 
(for $10 only, this was such a steal! the sauce is amazing and we scraped all of it with the frites and bread)  

---  grilled ribeye 
(the dollop of garlic butter compote really added love to the dish)



SERVICE HIGHLIGHTS:
===================
-- Apparently their $15 prix-fixe only applies to parties of 6 and less (we had 8), but the waiter allowed for us to order 2, which we pushed it to 3. 

-- Because I'm a total klutz, I spilled over a glass of wine which ended up completely drowning my sister's entree plate! Saving the day, our waiter immediately came over, cleaned it up, and said that he'll bring out a new plate of food for my sister in 5 minutes! Seriously, now that's boss!
author: Sue Y.

description: Yumeeee. We used Yelp to confirm where to go for dinner after a long day of touring the city and this place did not disappoint! The meal was so tasty & complete (we had the 1/2 chicken). Our waiter was friendly with lots of personality. Nice quaint, cozy spot- very romantic.
author: Nguyen A.

description:
Went there on 8/26/12. We had the swordfish which was completely delicious, cooked beautifully and with a melt in the mouth texture. We also had the scallops which came with the best side of mashed potato's I've tasted in...well, as long as I can remember. Followed by a rich and comforting creme brulee. 

Our waiter for the evening was the very competent, knowledge and affable Ken. In conclusion the experience was pleasurable and memorable. The food excellent, in the peak of freshness and cooked to perfection. We will be returning soon.
author: P R.

description:
I noticed this cute little restaurant the moment I moved into the Lower Haight neighborhood. It's very quaint with a romantic atmosphere.

When you're first seated, they bring you fresh bread french bread and dipping oil with pesto. OMG. Gluten-free diet went out the window. But alas, it was worth it.

The rest of my courses (yes- I had 3) were great. Mussels, a mixed green salad with a tasty vinaigrette, and grilled salmon with hollandaise. I was so stuffed by the end that I actually felt ill. Overeating can sometimes be a drag..

The service was meh. Nice waiter, but very distracted. They were busy so I semi-understand. I suggest not coming here if you're in much of a hurry.

All in all, good choice though. I will definitely be returning, especially for their 1/2 prices wine nights...and the bread.
author: Heather V.

description: OK food with service that leaves much to be desired. We made reservations for 7:15 and being as it was a busy Friday weren't seated until close to 7:30. Giving them the benefit of the doubt we settled into our cozy table. The seating is VERY close together and inside is very loud. We even found ourselves having to repeat because the table next to us was talking so loud. Again, it was a Friday and the restaurant is small, understandable. Our waitress was slightly rude and very frazzled, she took our order, then proceeded to come back 4 times with the wrong appetizer, after waiting for 35m we finally asked the manager for our crab cake. Once it arrived it was VERY good, and one gentleman busing tables came by to apologize for the delay. By the time our food came out we had been there close to an hour. The food looked as if it were slopped on the plate, no detail or careful execution was added, and this was super discouraging, especially after waiting for so long. I ordered the Shrimp Risotto which was well seasoned, but looked like it was spilled in the kitchen and dripping all over the bowl. We also ordered the chicken which had the same attention to plating. Overall it was dry and disappointing. I wish we could say we had a better experience but, overall the service was poor, and the waitress was rude and inattentive, we will not be returning.
author: K T.

description: It was my girlfriend and I first time in San Francisco and we were looking for a place to eat near our place in Fillmore. We ended up going to eat at Alamo Square Seafood Grill. The food was great! I had the Seafood Pasta and my girlfriend had the Blackened Trout from the Prefixe menu. Overall, the service was great and the atmosphere was exceptional. Check it out for yourself!
author: Jeremy L.

description: It was a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience.  The restaurant is immaculate, the dishware and wine glasses all spotless.  The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable and showed real courtesy towards us.  We went with the prix fixe menu which is a real bargain.  The wine was a very good pinot noir and we drained the bottle.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Steven Z.

description:
What a great neighborhood restaurant! Have always driven by this place and finally went in with friends and we had a great time. Mondays is half off wines (awesome!) and they have an early evening pre fixe (that we totally need to go back for). 

The food is great for the price and the atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. Our server was super sweet and she just let us do our thang. I loved their crispy Monterrey bay calamari with white bean salad and sweet curry aioli. I 'd be happy with an entree portion of it! I also enjoyed the mussels meuniere and the dipping sauce for their bread. Their menu is small but there's something for everyone. Will definitely return!
author: Vicente G.

description: What a sweet little spot! The fish and accompaniments were delicious, and the setting was cozy and romantic. A great French take on seafood-- we will definitely be back!
author: Laura W.

description: Hommy style restaurant that was very impressive me! A nice service and many fantastic seafood;) yummy!!!!
author: Supertiny C.

description: Even we made a reservation at place we waited 30 min outside. They are freakin slow and unorganized about that
author: Kaan S.

description:
This place is so cute! A cozy Parisian cafe in the middle of Alamo Square! And if it hadn't been suggested by a friend I would've never known it existed!

I was the first to arrive for a party of four. The host was friendly and briefly chatted with me while I waited for the rest of the party to show up. I ordered the mahi mahi special, while my dining companions ordered the vegetarian dish and the mussels and fries. The mahi mahi and risotto were delicious. The fish was perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The vegetarian dish was a risotto with various vegetables. I didn't taste it but the vegetarian said it was a tasty dish and beyond what she had expected at a seafood place. The fries that accompanied the mussels were not quite the shoestring fries I expected (they were a little too thick) but they were tasty.

This place is super cute and would be a great first date place. It's quiet enough to hear your dining companions and slightly cozy but not over the top romantic.
author: Dani D.

description: Nice service, delicious food and good dessert with wine. I've been to here several times for eating seafood with wine. Everything was good.
author: Miran S.

description: Fabulous dinner! Great server KEN! Extensive wine list / feels like a French bistro! Amazing menu options! Great prix fix menu! Great location ! Overall wonderful experience! Merci!
author: Barbara n.

description:
I love this place so much, I have been organizing a regular group get-together so that I can keep going back. We always get great service and the food is tasty and fresh. Since we're a fairly large group, we typically end up getting one of every appetizer, just about one of every kind of entree they offer, and one of each of their desserts. I have to say that I've sampled everything they have on the menu and have not had one disappointment in the bunch!

Keep it up. We'll be back!
author: S Z.

description: Really good food at an awesome value.  The recommendations from the servers were spot on.
author: Ravi R.

description: Service was super, appetizers ( crab cake and roasted cauliflower soup) , entrees ( vegetarian pasta and blackened snapper) and desert  were yummy.
author: David W.

description:
I really can't sit here and think of why I should give this place 4 stars instead of 5.  My meal was amazing, and the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive.  Great atmosphere, you're in a very intimate, relaxing setting.  Great music playing too - I heard some Thom Yorke and U2, but not blaring - just the relaxing jams.

As for the food: I had blackened Snapper with Beurre Maitre d'Hotel sauce (parsley butter) and grilled vegetables.  It was recommended by one of the staff - and damn was he spot on.  I couldn't stop talking about how incredible it was.

The girlfriend (btw - great date spot) had their special - sea scallops with leek risotto and asparagus.  She's not sure what the sauce was, but she loved it.  

I guess this is out of order, but our appetizers were their bread with some amazing olive oil/garlic/basil/red pepper dipping sauce.  I couldn't stop stuffing my face.  We polished off the bread - something we rarely do before dinner.  We also had the mussels with white wine, shallots, and herb broth with pommes frit.  The mussels were HUGE.  And really good.  Sauce could've maybe used some more garlic.  

That's that - we loved it.  Great date spot (xmas lights outside the front door is a nice touch and makes for some great lighting), great food, and great people.
author: Matt L.

description:
I thought this place was very good. I had the Atlantic Salmon, blackened with the peppercorn sauce, I thought it was delicious.  The other two I was with had the seared Ahi, and they both enjoyed theirs as well. 

Between three of us with meals and ~5 glasses of wine, it only came out to just over $100, so I'd say that is reasonable.

I would consider going back to this place if I'm back in town.
author: David S.

description: These people do fish right! Fantastic service, you'll be so lucky if Alice is working, she knows so much about food and fish and preparations. Everything is super fresh, the menu changes often, you can not go wrong with anything on the menu. And they're so willing to adjust for personal preferences. The restaurant is small and extremely cozy (I hate that over used word but it's extremely accurate in this case), you just don't want to leave when the meal is over. Can't say enough good things about this place. Really. I'm considering making it a weekly event.
author: barry s.

description: It was great! Reasonable prices and great food! We went on Tuesday and it was 1/2 off glasses of wine. I'll definitely be back again!
author: Nicole T.

description:
This place is so yummy, relaxing and perfectly romantic! Since my last review I've been back twice and have died both times over the sea scallops, which just melt in your mouth. The first time they were served with polenta, and the second with creamy mashed potatoes. We also tried the smoked trout salad and the blackened swordfish which were unbelievably good. 

We also decided to get decadent and try the desserts, I can't decide if I liked the apple bread pudding or the creme brulee better. 

Ken,  our server and couldn't have been more welcoming and accommodating. He also had great suggestions for what wine to pair with our meal.

This is a perfect date destination. Before dinner you can walk up to Alamo Square and take in the view, and then after you can walk to Divisadero, the Fillmore, or even the Haight neighborhoods to catch a show.

As a side, head to the bathroom and take a look at the awesome framed newspaper clipping advertising the grand opening of the restaurant in the 30s. So fascinating.
author: Jamie F.

description:
Great fresh seafood, comfortable ambiance , byob, and reasonable prices

-monterey bay calmari w/sweet curry aoli and grilled red snapper beurre blanc = awesome

After reading reviews about bad service, I was a bit nervous.  Although dishes took a bit longer then some larger restaurants - the food was worth the wait.  It is a smaller place so that is totally understandable in my book. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful in making recommendations.  

For those who are crying about bad service/waiting a few extra minutes for fresh and well prepared seafood -  I suggest you find better company to go to dinner with, have an extra glass of wine, realize servers have "off" days sometimes  and chill out!
author: Dana G.

description:
Where was Andre last night????? This would have been 5 stars if Andre was there..but instead....we had to give 3 stars (just for service; food was 5, and when Andre is there on Wed. and Friday food and service is 5). My boyfriend and I took our guest (boyfriends mother) here visiting from Iowa because last experience we had at Alamo was amazing (Andre was our server). We showed up at 7:30 for our reservation and the place was not crowded at all, maybe 5 other tables total in the restaurant. We sit down, and our server asked us what we wanted to drink, my boyfriend said "I will have sparkling water." Then our guest and myself said, "we will have some sparking water too." The waitress comes back with 3 HUGE bottles of Perrier ($7.00/each) and just sets it on the table. It looked ridiculous, why would we order 3 huge bottles of $7 water each? She takes back 2 of the waters and then comes back to take our app order and wine order. My boyfriend ordered a bottle of Chard wine...the waitress came out, poured us the smallest glass of wine I have ever seen (like a tasting portion), then left the table and the wine bottle was gone! When she came back, my boyfriend asked her where our bottle of wine went and she said "I am so out of it tonight, I don't know where it went." She went back to look for it and it was I believe in the fridge...who knows if it was poured for another customer? Then our apps come out (calamari and crab cakes), and the waitress just slams the calamari down on top of one of the share plates and leaves quickly (my I add that our table has not been cleared yet, from the bread basket and dirty plates on the table from the bread). Then she drops off the crab cakes and sets it right down in front of me and leaves again.....the table is big enough to place the shared apps in the middle of the table so we can all enjoy it.... 

The waitress also brought out tap water in the middle of the dinner and set it all in one spot in the corner of the table....still not removing the dirty dishes on the table. 


Now for the main course: Our two meals come out (we shared 2 fish dishes), and the waitress doesn't even bring us share plates...when I asked her for share plates, she said "oh, you mean you want a clean plate?" WHAT?????? We thought this was fine dining, as we experienced before when Andre was our server. 

We skipped desert this time just because we knew it was time to go....Decided to write this yelp review so Andre knows about his servers and the lack of professionalism and knowledge they have....This restaurant is amazing and the food is delicious, its just too bad that bad service could make the whole dining experience so terrible. I have been a server in my past and know how important it is to have good service and build relationships with your customers (there was no relationship building at all, as well as lack of knowledge about the menu, etc.)
author: Karley A.

description:
I came to Alamo Square Seafood Grill with the boyfriend for Valentine's Day. We wanted seafood and this seemed like a cute, little spot.

They were offering a special Valentine's Day menu and everything sounded delicious! We decided to get one of everything so we could try everything offered that night (I'm not sure if these dishes are on their regular menu). For starters, I had the celery root soup and my boyfriend had the chilled asparagus with crab and hollandaise sauce. Out of the two, I loved the celery root soup! It was perfect since it was a cold night and there was tons of flavor. The asparagus was good but it wasn't quite what I was expecting, however the crab was very fresh.

For our entrees, my boyfriend had the scallops with a warm potato salad and green beans and I had the duck with corn polenta and green beans. This was my first time having duck, and while I thought it was delicious, it just wasn't for me!
