I LOVED the scallops and the potato salad, there was tons of flavor and the scallops practically melted in your mouth. The boyfriend and I really enjoyed both dishes but the scallops stole the show!

There's always room for dessert, and we both shared the bread pudding and the chocolate cake. Both were delicious and amazingly sweet but our favorite was the bread pudding. I loved that it was covered with almonds!

I had read previous reviews about the service being bad, but we didn't experience any of that. We had great service and our server was very attentive. The only complaint I had was that I felt a little rushed through dinner and I also felt a little cramped, but that's because it's such a small restaurant. 

Alamo Square Seafood Grill offers fresh and delicious seafood in a cute and comfortable environment. It's perfect for a date night and will definitely be back in the future.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
What a cute little neighborhood spot. It's small and intimate and they have pretty great food!

I had the calamari, mussels, sea scallops, and beef bourgignon. 
Calamari was bland but crunchy.
The mussels were good with fries to dip in the sauce.
Sea scallops were the best thing! Cooked to perfection.
The beef was a little salty for my taste but tender.

Service was good. 
Wine was decent, a little watered down my date said.

I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Melissa T.

description: Eh nothing special. Yelp failed me on this one. Expensive food and so not worth the price. Mussels were overcooked and way too salty. Good thing I got a bottle of chard because that made everything a tiny bit better. Not much though.
author: J C.

description:
I gotta say, this place was a very, very pleasant surprise.  We stumbled in here in a pique after being brusquely rebuffed at State Bird Provisions.  To indulge our very grumpy moods, we decided to walk all the way back home, hungry as heck.  This place looked quaint, and we like seafood, so we figured "what the heck?"  As it turned out, it was a fantastic decision.  

At 8:30PM on a Friday, it wasn't too full, but not entirely dead.  The servers were consequently very attentive and polite.  However, the drawback of a not-super-busy restaurant that serves primarily seafood is that it takes a bit of time to get your scallops.  But that's just the price you gotta pay.  Come here on the date, as the environment (and affordable, approachable wine list) is great, and you won't be rushed out after 40 minutes.

The food was great.  We got both the fish special and the steak special,and both were expertly cooked.  These guys must use an internal thermometer or something, as it really was super tender without being underdone.  I also note that they were very accommodating about me getting a side of a sauce that was supposed to come with another dish.  That's always a plus in my book.

All-in-all, a very good under-the-radar date spot in a quiet part of town.  A great place to catch up with friends, too!
author: Eugene M.

description:
Yummy amazing...there are not enough words to describe this place, I found this placd via tripadvisor & yelp and had good reviews, but this place is outstanding, I'm assumming the owner or manager Ken is a very nice man, runs a very tight "ship" and deffinently knows what he is doing.

I recommend the crab cakes and mussles. I also had the red snapper and my boyfriend had the sorwdfish, both were melt in your mouth fantastic. I well deffinently go back to this place when ever I come back to this city.
author: Melinda F.

description: I have now eaten here twice.  IT is becoming my favorite pre show restaurant.  The fix prix menu has been delicious both times tat I have been.  The server/owner/manager (I'm not sure actually) but she is friendly informative and helpful and has both times greeted us with a smile.  I work in the service industry so I always try to be non descript when visiting other places just to take it all in.  I love this place and wish I lived closer so that I could enjoy it more often!!!
author: Blain H.

description: Aw I gave them 4 stars (why did I not give 5 from the get-go?!?!) and they wrote to thank me. They are such a nice management team. Super!! Loved it. Can't wait to go back.
author: Maryam M.

description:
Ok neighborhood place but not if you are coming to SFO for some good food and fun vibe don't bother. Quaint bistro but feels a bit dingy with pillows that don't smell too hot. Fish soup was tasty but was mostly cubes of fish. Would have been nice with a Large shrimp or two with shell for flavor and variety. Escargots were dry and not much flavor. Serving in shells might look cooler but lacks classic butter green garlic richness. 
We ordered the duck rare and it came medium. Friendly service but wouldn't go back considering how much more than city has to offer.
author: Lou S.

description: Great food bistro style. Prices true to the quality and style. Very cozy and cute places. I got prix fix which is super cheap $14.95 for 3 course meal, but was still a bit hungry after, but I have a huge appetite. Next time extra starter!
author: Anna B.

description: Beautiful servers and delicious fishy concoctions! What more could you ask for? We came in on a Monday and were served by a very tall, elegant British girl who made sure our every need was satisfied. I ordered the blackened snapper with green peppercorn sauce and some fried calamari, both thoroughly delightful. I will certainly be back!
author: Minty F.

description:
After being recommended this restaurant twice in one week, I knew I had to try this place.  Both recommendations came with rave reviews for the prix fixe menu, given a limited budget.  The prix fixe menu, available 5:30 until 7, comes with soup or salad, the chef's entree of the day, and the dessert of the day.

My boyfriend and I both ordered the prix fixe menu.  The bread came with an excellent dipping sauce, tasted like butter and garlic and parsley.  The bread was nothing special, but that was the only food item that wasn't amazing.  My salad was pretty normal and his zucchini curry soup was fantastic.  The entree, salmon with a Bearnaise sauce, was excellent.  Extremely fresh with a flavorful sauce.  Even the rice and steamed veggies were excellent!  Dessert was a "floating island," or meringue in custard.  I had never had meringue quite like it but it was delicious.  Also, my boyfriend was able to enjoy a Krusovice, a Czech beer he hadn't been able to find since Prague, another factor that will be sure to ensure our return to this restaurant!

The restaurant also has a great ambiance.  Dimly lit and very romantic, everything is very nicely designed.  It's a small restaurant and the waitresses were friendly.  The food came quickly, but when the restaurant filled up service did slow down a bit.  Certainly not a bad place to have to wait a little while though!
author: Rachael M.

description: It's a great place near Alamo Square.  I've eaten here a number of times, and have consistently enjoyed our meals.  It's a great value.  The food is very good.  Lively and casual atmosphere.  Andre, the owner, is very accommodating.  Among other items, they are known for having 4 different fishes, which  you can have cooked one of 4 different ways, then served with one of 6 different sauces.  It's a great concept, you can have it your way.  I'll be back.
author: David F.

description:
Alamo Square Seafood Grill is a quaint, perfect neighborhood restaurant. It's quiet and tucked away on Fillmore and Grove. How perfect to walk right off of Alamo Square and into this place. Sit in the cozy window nook and people watch as you enjoy your meal.

The food is great. Whenever I have the opportunity to have escargots in garlic and parsley butter (Escargots a la Bourguignon for you fancy folk) you better believe I take advantage of it. Definitely order this dish as an appetizer. Grilled shrimp ceviche is also very good and very fresh. I think they have a really nice selection of entrees and great specials. Fish specialities are wonderful, yet difficult to decide which route to take. I opted for blackened swordfish With their ProvenCale sauce perfectly paired with saffron rice and fresh veggies. Oh yeah and the Grilled Rib Eye is killer.

Definitely a great restaraunt. Enjoy!
author: Denise S.

description:
I could not believe the service at this place. My family and I are not picky or demanding. We waited for an hour for our food which was ok since we were enjoying each other's company. But at the hour when we asked for another basket of bread for our hungry 2.5 year old daughter and were told by our server, "I can't keep replenishing your bread ... there's just not enough for the people here".   WHAT?  Dude, it was bread. And what... Are we not here?  And it was the first time we asked for more. We spent $245 for dinner and this guy have us attitude for asking for bread after waiting an hour for food. 

That was the icing on the cake. We had to ask 3x to get another round of beer. 

For the manager - our server was Ken and he was terrible. I hope you address it - I'm sure he's good at something - but service is just not it. He's ruining an otherwise decent venue. 

Get rid if the poison  

Would not recommend it. The staff lacks the humility required to serve patrons with respect.
author: Ron C.

description: Hassan was super friendly and helpful when it came to deciding how to get our fish done. The clam chowder and the smoked trout salad were excellent. I had the shrimp risotto which was very tasty. My fiancé had the red snapper blackened with Bernaise sauce and everything was very reasonably priced. The ambiance was also delightful. Really happy to have found this gem.
author: Einas H.

description:
This place always leaves me happy and feeling a little more romantic. It's dimly lit, warmly inviting, and overall pleasant. 

If I'm not having grilled salmon with peppercorn sauce I'm falling prey to the specials. Trust the specials. They are solid. While you're at it, don't bother asking for what the soup of the day is, just get it. You can thank me later.

The wine selection has been good but if you prefer to byow, there is no corkage on Wednesdays. Otherwise, enjoy the wine (because we certainly have) particularly on Mondays when it is half off. 

If possible, save room for dessert.
author: Loli L.

description: 530pm dinner on a Friday. Excellent. 6 of us-we were early and Suzanna let us in and we relaxed into a terrific evening. The price is right. Yummy!!!  Some stars of the show: Chorizo mussels, basil garlic pesto dipping sauce, seared ahi tuna, flourless chocolate cake.
author: Carol E.

description: Salty, slow, and stale. I got the mussels and frites which were less than mediocre. I had to send the oily,  droopy frites back (and I never send food back) and the replacement frites weren't much better -- flavorless like they had been frozen for a long time. My companions got the scallops and the salmon and said their dishes were merely OK. The plates looked like what you might receive at hotel conference luncheon. Our server was attentive. Thank god we brought our own wine.
author: Miz J.

description: Love this place. Such a great neighborhood spot.  Off the beaten path but cozy and delicious.
author: Scott V.

description:
Food is pretty good  and prices are very reasonable.
 
The service is super slow though and it's really hard to get their attention. And when you ask them for something it takes forever to get it... not rude but not friendly either.

No corkage fee on Wednesday is a good deal as well.
author: Aphrodite L.

description:
Ladies and gentlemen:  There are plenty of options in San Francisco where the food is good, and you are not treated like trash.  We brought two bottles of wine for a birthday celebration (6 of us) - happy with the corkage fee, and when we asked the waiter if we could have them opened, he rudely said, "Um, we will only open 1 bottle of wine."   Not rudely, we told him that we were confused because the website had said up to 2 bottles, and he rudely said, "Oh, the website is wrong.  It needs to be changed."  Then we pointed on the menu where it said 2 bottles, and he said, "Oh, the menus are wrong, they need to be reprinted."

We walked after that.  First time in my life I have walked out of a restaurant.  So my dear foodies, we did not try the food.  But man, if the staff is that horrible - the food can't be worth it.  

They seem to not care whether you come to their restaurant or not, so you might as well not go.
author: Richard H.

description:
I live only a couple houses down from this place, and eat here at least once a month. I have dreams about the chorizo mussels. I love their specials, especially on Wednesdays with Free corkage nights. 

I get the scallops almost every time, and they are always fabulous.

The atmosphere is quaint and charming. The prices are also VERY reasonable, especially for seafood in San Francisco. I would (and have) highly recommend this place to friends and family. I think I'll take my boyfriend there tonight now that I think about it.
author: Heather K.

description: A cute little seafood restaurant near Alamo Square! My husband and I came here to celebrate my birthday - awesome decision.  The restaurant is small and quaint, so the staff is super attentive during your meal. They were very helpful in our meal and dessert choices too.  The food was delicious! Moist, savory, and light. Really enjoyed our visit - would recommend!
author: Rebekah K.

description:
The food here was pretty good.  We got the blackened salmon, which was wonderful, and the calamari, which was nice.

If this review were just food, I'd give it four stars.

The service, however, is terrible.

We were seated and then ignored - didn't even order or get water - for 20 minutes.  

Our order was taken 30 minutes after being seated.

We got bread 45 minutes after being seated.  I think someone just noticed we didn't have any.  There appear to be only one or two staff members who take care of guests when they notice there's a problem or have a moment, and this was a Saturday night.  I had to ask for more water.  Wine came in a dirty glass.

Our food - only one meal - didn't come out for an hour and 15 minutes after being seated.  We paid with cash to avoid another long wait.

I noticed the couple next to us got to the restaurant 15 minutes after we did, had two big meals, and were paid and left before we even got wine.

It's a shame that this place isn't better.  The food is good and the ambiance is lovely, so if the service weren't so bad this would be a great place.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I used to live two blocks away, and would come here to splurge, or with a friend. And my sentiments may be colored by rose-tinted glasses. However:

They do exceptionally well with seafood. I had mussels once here, and was astonished that they were at a level of perfection I have rarely encountered: neither undercooked (shells not fully opened) nor over-cooked (mussels shrunk to tiny nubbins) but at the delightful moment when they are fully cooked, but still mostly filling the shell, and wonderfully tender.

I've had grilled fish here that was equally delicious.

Other things they do not do so well; the wedge salad is adequate, but not impressive, and I don't advise ordering anything but a fish entree.

But for a small, neighborhood restaurant in an area not known for restaurants -- it's pretty remarkable.
author: Greg C.

description: Solid meal.  Nice established neighborhood restaurant.
author: Derek J.

description: I come here on Mondays.... At least once a month, often more.  The specials are always great, affordable and it's 1/2 price bottle of wine day.  Reservations are always a must and a plus in my book.  The scallops or the ahi are my go-to.  My fiancée loves the red snapper and ceviche, mom loves the pasta and my dad is the wild card.  The calamari is a winner as well.... And their wine list is affordable, tasty, and noteworthy!  Service has greatly improved over a short period of time I wold like to add.
author: blair k.

description:
Bubbly.

Mood was not good. It was great.

It had been ten months since the world unexpectedly started going dark (http://www.yelp.com/biz/kaiser-permanente-allergy-optometry-and-physical-therapy-san-francisco#hrid:cyWubrjtkpyDKDjD0UT3Pg). Day prior was a successful third and what should be final surgery to keep the world light.

Right eye vision is far from perfect. But far from blind. Being able to once again read the label on a bottle of champagne called for some champagne.

Alamo Square Seafood Grill has long been on the list. Neighborhood icon. Charming space. And BYOB Wednesdays.

Surgery Tuesday. Champagne Wednesday.

We were seated at a corner table with a view (literally) of the entire restaurant. Server popped the champagne. You can bet I was covering my eye.

Started with the grilled ceviche. Not as celebratory as the mood. Plenty of avocado. Not much shrimp. Always hope for but rarely get the reverse.

Continued with the vegetarian pasta and swordfish. Great to look at. Even better to eat.

Pasta featured more vegetables than your typical salad. Came with a cream sauce that they had no problem doing without. In fact you could say it made the dish better by not detracting from the ingredients. Loved.

Swordfish was equally good. Part of a build your own with multiple fishes, sauces and cooking methods to choose from. Generous portion. Rich in flavor. Provençale sauce proved to be the perfect complement. Also loved.

We finished with rich ice cream covered with a richer chocolate sauce topped with balls of fried dough. Not any everyday decision. This was not just any day. Loved. Probably too much.

About $30/person which included a tip that assumed we had paid for the bottle.

Server was attentive and patient as we took time to choose. More points for opening the champagne without the cork flying everywhere. 

Great value. Great location. Great food. Great service. Great reason to celebrate.
author: Jason B.

description: I'm a little surprised by all the glowing reviews based on our dinner experience here.  First of all, after we checked in for our reservation, we waited about 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us--no menus, no water, no greeting, nothing.  We were thinking about leaving when finally someone approached us with the menus.  We asked for water.  Another 15 minutes passed before someone arrived to take our orders.  Still no water.  Finally, 10 minutes after we had placed our order, did someone bring water to our table.  So pretty much 40 minutes sitting at a table, without water.  We then waited another 20 minutes before our appetizer arrived, the escargot, with a belated explanation that this dish "takes a while."  I don't understand why, I've ordered escargot many places and it has never taken that long.  The food itself was okay.  The escargot was tasty but due to the liberal amounts of butter and garlic.  The fish entrees were okay.  I didn't think they were that well prepared, and not that flavorful.  We then waited more to just get our check.  Long waits, mediocre food?  Probably won't be back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
There are a lot of good restaurants around here, and if you eat out a lot, it's hard to choose a place to go when you want something more special, but aren't up for something as fancy as Jardiniere or Gary Danko. This is that place. 
The menu is simple and straightforward, the service is nearly always really spot-on and professional, the staff very accomodating, and the food impressively good. Also a great place for dates, special occasions, or bringing visitors while you're serving as SF tour guide.
author: queue q.

description: The blackened trout was AWESOME. Everyone was very nice, but you should not be in a hurry. Highly recommended!
author: Jorge R.

description:
Love this place!
Tiny little gem tucked away in Alamo Square.  Fresh, fresh, fresh seafood cooked virtually any way you want it, ample portions, tasty sides, great service and very reasonably priced. What more could you ask for?!
Oh...a reasonably priced wine list and yummy desserts add to the wonder of it all.
Bear in mind, this place is small and cozy but not so much so that you can't have a conversation without the world knowing your business.
If you're an early diner go for the Prix Fixe menu, it cannot be beat.
Go, you'll love it too!
author: Us And J.

description: Service and food both top notch.  Nice to go to a neighborhood place and avoid the tourists. Quiet, comfortable, no lines, no crowds and the food is affordable.
author: Spyke P.

description:
My uncle and aunt from San Jose made reservations here based on another website for peer review, (can't remember which) and the place was a 3 (maybe 3 and 1/4). Why you ask? I'll tell you...

I'd read some reviews of this place before (from yelp, duh) and I saw that this group of six ladies which ALL happen to have a bad experience gave a really low rating, so I said, sucks for them, but one's own experience is usually not the same for everybody. 

This restaurant feels like a cozy, local place, filled with locals that you'll get to know because the space between the tables forces you to stick your butt out to get out, creating an embarrassing moment that turns to a shared laughter between you and your weirded-out neighbor.

The food was just OK. I had the crispy calamari to start, not bad, then the seared tuna with that herb and white whine sauce. Tuna perfectly cooked (barely cooked, like I like it) but it came out cold. I though maybe because it got very little heat, but no.  The rice and vegetables were also cold, which only proves my theory. And it was under seasoned. Also the food took forever to come like it was the Messiah.

My sister ordered the vegetable risotto. Risotto my ass! It was plain, mundane rice with some mushrooms and beans. Wasn't moist and cheesy like a risotto should be!

For dessert, the vanilla creme brulee. Second best part of the meal. Best part, you ask? The bread with that chimichurri type sauce at the beginning, and the bread wasn't that good. Ok, so it was the sauce. That's is the onle single thing I would give it the "great" adjective.
author: Eli N.

description:
A decent neighborhood spot.

Just don't trying coming here on Valentine's Day, as I did one year, with a single girlfriend to celebrate singledom. It might serve only to further depress you both.

UPDATE 1/12:
An out of town guest responded, "bistro" to my "What do you want for dinner?" and we walked over to  Alamo Square Seafood Grill. Turned out to be a great meal. You can have your fish cooked any way like with a sauce of your choice. I had the salmon, grilled, in a red wine demi-glace. Good value, tasty, and served with rice and fresh vegetables. As I left I wondered to myself, "Why don't I come here more often?"

UPDATE 3/14:
On Wednesday, there's no corkage! So bring your own wine and enjoy.
author: Miriam W.

description:
A cute seafood cafe that's definitely worth a visit, especially for their prix fixe or on a Monday (half-priced bottle night).

Food: A surprising amount of spice for seafood. Both the salmon tartare and the scallop special had some kick to them. The scallops were  cooked and presented well, and were served with a truly decadent risotto. The red pepper/soy sauce in which the scallops were served didn't quite match or complement the dish, though, and I ended up pulling the scallops off to the side.

Service: As other reviewers have mentioned, service is slow.  There really was only one server (who was also the busser AND the host) for the entire restaurant. The restaurant is tiny, but not tiny enough for one person to be doing all these jobs.  That said, he was friendly, polite, and didn't act (or make us feel) too rushed. We kept ourselves occupied with the bread basket while we waited for our food, and we weren't in a rush, so we didn't end up having any complaints. 

Important note: The half-priced wine list on Mondays only applies to the back page of the wine list, not their house wines.
author: Lauren H.

description: Although the food was good, the service really made the entire experience terrible. Our waitress was rude to not just our party, but rude to the party next to us as well. My boyfriend and I ordered the shrimp ceviche, and when it came we noticed there wasn't any shrimp in it. I could tell that our server did not like it when you questioned anything she gave you, but alas, my boyfriend asked if it indeed was supposed to have shrimp. She said it was supposed to have shrimp and that our dish does contain shrimp, and she knows this for a fact.  She said she saw it being prepared. Well... there wasn't any there. Without shrimp, it was just guacamole. I didn't want to make a big deal so instead of saying, "show me," we just blew it off and apologized- happily eating the "shrimp ceviche" (aka guacamole) because at that point we were starving and this lady was not going to back down or show any type of customer service. When I received my scallops later, she came by to check on us. She noticed that I had three scallops on my plate and said, "I know you didn't see the shrimp before, but can you see the scallops now?" And then walked away.  I think she knew how shocked I was that she said that because when she gave us our check, she said she took 20% off the ceviche for us. A whopping $2 off. Not exactly the kind of thing that makes up for being humiliated by a server in front of your boyfriend for absolutely no reason.
author: Amanda J.

description:
Alamo has a really well-priced prix fixe dinner menu (if you get there on the right day). On our visit the bread was good, but the rest was sort of forgettable. I wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars. I feel like there was potential, so I'll add a half.

When you enter there's a heavy curtain shielding the tables from the cold, and then there's tiny tables all along the sides. It sucks when you have to try to maneuver to sit at your table by sliding your ass next to another table. Thankfully I didn't fart.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Cute little restaurant with a romantic atmosphere.
They have a very reasonable prix fixe menu if you come early, their regular prices aren't half bad either. 
Their basil dip they serve with their fresh bread is soo tasty!
author: Anne N.

description:
In fairness, I did NOT eat there and I probably won't EVER eat there --and I will tell you why-- you decide.
So on  Friday night my girlfriend and I are out for a nice meal, and I think--"oh yeah, there is a quaint neighborhood restaurant I have always wanted to try, let me go out of my way and see if it's open."  
So, I drive by and the "Open" sign beckons in it's glorious neon--I see people inside, and some open tables. "GREAT!"  I think, no need to look them up, it's past 10pm and I can obviously see that they are open-- SURELY they would not have that sign on if they were not seating guests!"
Therein lies the rub, and I know, these are "1st world problems"--still, this is indicative of serious lameness:
SO, I spend a good 25 minutes trying to park in that neighborhood, and finally find a spot about 4 blocks away, and my girlfriend and I trudge up the hill...  
we start to go inside and a guy who works there says, "oh, we are closed"  (note, he is standing beneath the well lit "OPEN" sign in glowing neon.)  
I say "SERIOUSLY?  what's with the sign?  I saw it and just spent 25 minutes parking for no reason?!?!"
"yeah, we are closed, we close at 10:00"  No apology, starts going inside--  I get him to come back out-- "um, WHY is the SIGN ON?"
Classic lame-ass douche bag "I don't get paid enough to care" answer:
"oh, you see, we have to step on this bench to shut the light off and there were people sitting here before."  (The bench is empty). He steps up on the bench and shuts the sign off.
COME ON BRO-- YOU SUCK--go to your local hardware store and get an extension cord switch or whatever. Or if you can't do that, say SORRY when someone tells you they just wasted half an hour trying to go to your restaurant.

 I don't think the owners would like to think that you just killed a potential regular--  I go to restaurants where people are COOL multiple times a month.
So, with a good 30 minutes wasted of my date night,  I went to India Clay Oven down the road, amazing food, amazing service, politeness. Duh.   Owners of Alamo Square Seafood Grill--it was a young white male, tall with dark hair-- tell the guy he could have said this : "SORRY YOU WENT OUT OF YOUR WAY, we would love to see you guys again" (as opposed to:  "COME ON, we have a VERY complicated lighting system that I can't possibly handle and I will NOT apologize for.) WHATEVER.
author: Kurt S.

description: Came here after being recommended the Prix Fixe. The vibe of the restaurant was very nice. Excellent music in the background. Cozy and warm. The bread and pesto dip they give you while waiting was AMAZING!! I could eat that for the rest of my life. When it came to my food, however, I was a little disappointed. The price was great ($14.50 for soup/salad, entree and dessert), but there was nothing spectacular about the meal. Basic mixed green salad. Fish that tasted fine, but unimpressive. Meringue dessert that was just okay. I would definitely come here again based on the environment, prices and the other things on the menu.
author: Courtney R.

description: I've visited over the years since I'm just a block away. I liked it better 10 years ago. We once had a wonderful dinner with a group of friends where everything was on point. They raved and it made me proud to have such a nice little known neighborhood gem. They've since undergone new ownership or management and I've since had too many meals here that have left a lot to be desired - The fish too fishy, my risotto almost still frozen in the middle (that was really eye opening for me). I haven't been back in a few ears so I don't know if things have improved but I'm not really keen to find out.
author: Kiki W.

description:
Since we found this gem in December we've been back several times, last time being 3/27.  Each time all the food we had was delicious, reasonably priced & in a wonderful setting.  While our waiter was very busy, he was friendly and didn't  rush.  We've had many different things on the menu now.  We brought both our grown kids & mother too.  

I should mention, I don't get dessert often but here, I get it every single time because it's that good!  This is such a great place!  We love it!
author: Donna W.

description:
This is a great little restaurant tucked into a small quaint neighborhood.  I took my family here for an anniversary celebration on a Friday night.  I would advise reservations because you will have to wait especially on a weekend.  

I ordered a sauteed red snapper with warm garlic and parsley butter.  Loved the warm garlic and parsley butter.  Fish was so-so.  My family loved the dishes they ordered.  Grandma got sick that night after ordering the seafood soup.  Reasonable prices for their dishes.  Ask your server for their recommendations.  Great place to go on date!  Parking is easy to find.
author: Jen S.

description: Sweet little spot, quiet and unassuming.  The portions were large enough to split, and the prices were reasonable!
author: Lisa C.

description: Love this neighborhood seafood place. It's unusual in many parts of San Francisco to find places with a nice ambience and good sit-down service, without being heinously trendy, expensive, and difficult to get into. Their specials are always a winner I always look forward to coming back.
author: Christopher E.

description:
I love this place! I have been here several times and it is always amazing. It's a great date spot but also a good place to take your parents or catch up with friends because it is quiet and cozy actually allowing to hear the person you are having dinner with. I love that they usually play French music and the staff is always friendly and attentive...the Chris Daughtry look-a-like server is really nice! 

The fish is alway fresh and delish and the specials are always great! They also have some good deals too. I'm not exactly sure the times but they have a cheap prix fixed meal during certain hours and deals on bottles of wine certain nights of the week!
author: Ris C.

description:
I came here for dinner one night with my friends to take advantage of the free corkage on Wednesday night, and enjoyed it so much I came back the second night solo. 

Alamo is smart, keeping the menu small and doing everything on it well. The food is exceptional and the prices incredibly reasonable for the type of food being served and the awesome ambiance.

If you order the fish (you should), you can choose from four preps: grilled, sauteed, blackened or poached; and five sauces: bernaise, buerre blanc, provencale, one that's just garlic and butter, and a peppercorn and red-wine reduction. Our fish was cooked perfectly, our waiter was awesome, and the dessert was ridiculous -- a chocolate ganache that made even this chocoholic put her fork down before the end. My second night back I had crab cakes that were some of the best I've had in years.

The restaurant itself is very pleasant. Small and intimate, pleasantly dark with warm lighting. Great music. Perfect for a romantic date or just hanging with your pals.
author: Barbara M.

description:
What a lovely dining experience!
Loved the sea scallops, crab cakes, escargot, salad with fruit and candied walnuts. The table bread with pesto dipping sauce was delicious too. 
I was too full to have dessert.
If you're in a hurry, don't go.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
I have been here a few times, as my best friend and her husband live nearby. I was there just there this past Wednesday and the place was pretty busy (good sigh!). It's a fun date spot as some yelpers have said, but also just a great place to have a delicious meal with friends. I have had some amazing fish meals here. This past week, I had the mahi-mahi special - YUM! My meal was perfectly cooked. I also had their special soup of the day (mushroom)..YUUUUUM!

The service is also great. We had an awesome server, Jonathan - he was hilarious, attentive & polite.

I'd recommend to anyone who wants a nice cozy spot for dinner!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
Just had our first meal at this restaurant and we couldn't be happier. The waiter, Ken, actually recognized us from over a year ago when we met him at this restaurant's sister location, Blue Jay Cafe. Not only that, he remembered our preference for fish entrees and made recommendations to us. This guy has an incredible memory, and he's very polite to boot. 
We got the calamari which was served on a bed of salad. Unusual for me, but the combinations of flavors worked together very well. We were there before 7 p.m. So we got the fixed menu for each of us. On this particular night, it was a creamy potato and celery soup, seared rainbow trout for the entree, along with rice and vegetables on the side, and a light and fluffy "Floating Island" with strawberries for dessert.  For all of $15 for each of us, this is an insane deal. You definitely want to come early, as this deal is only available from opening to 7 p.m. 
The only downside is that we'll probably not go to Blue Jay Cafe much anymore, as both restaurants are close together and this one comes out on top both for the food and Ken's warm and friendly service.
We were already discussing what we would try next time before we even got the bill. We will definitely be back.
author: Aaron K.

description: We came to the restaurant at 8:30 pm. They asked what we would like to drink, and after that we have been waiting for a bottle of wine for about 20 minutes. They didn't take the order for food until they brought the bottle of wine. After they finally took the order we had the food served by 9:30. While waiting for the food they didn't offer any bread, and when we asked for it they replied that unfortunately they are out of bread. This is not my first time at this restaurant, but such a strange service we received first time. Nobody even bother to explain why it took so long to fulfill our order, or even apologize. It is too sad that my good and nice experience with this restaurant in the past was overwritten with today's visit experience :-(
author: Helen T.

description:
If you're going to put the specials on the chalkboard, PRINT, not script. When we asked if we could hear the specials since we could not read it, there was an almost imperceptible roll of the eyes. As the next group sat down, they asked too. Great start. 

Crispy calamari was good. I do not care for mix and match sauces with fish. Wine list was reasonably priced. Tables were crowded. Food was adequate, but I can find plenty of adequate in SF without the attitude.
author: A I.

description: We went on a Monday night so it was quiet and romantic.  The food was superb and service attentive.  It was a "date night" for us and we both had a really nice time.  I highly recommend the calamari as well as the fish soup!  Also, Monday night is 1/2 price for any wine on their wine list!  Great time to experiment.  The server was knowledgable and helpful.
author: Roxanne M.

description: I had always wanted to check out this little gem whenever I walked by it.  I finally did and I was definitely pleased.  The food was great and it had a great ambiance.  On Wednesdays you can bring your own bottle of wine!  That's always a sign of a great place.
author: Francisco A.

description: Perfect little neighborhood spot, love the no-corkage fee deal on wednesdays. Good food, service, priced well. . . What's not to like?
author: Rob G.

description: Went last night on a first date. Ken the host gave us what I thought was the best table in the restaurant because we go to sit à côte but as I looked around at how freakin' charming and Parisian this place is I realized there were no bad places to sit.  I was starving so I started with a bowl of the tomato and basil soup. Ok, I ate two bowls. Tomato soup is my favorite thing in the world and this was delicious.  After I had the salmon but couldn't finish it because of aforementioned soup, but had it for lunch today.  I was however able to squeeze in a crème brûlée.  What I like about this place is its lack of pretense. It's laid back, charming with a great wine list. Perfect date place but also there were two or three tables of parties of six who seemed to be having a great time.  A perfect Saturday night!
author: Beachi Z.

description:
I need to come here as often as possible. I've only been here a couple of times, both times because couldn't get a reservations at NOPA (which is just fine, you can't hear yourself talk in that place) and have always been more than satisfied. 

I really love places that I have a hard time deciding what to get because everything looks so good. But even better is that everything here would be really easy to have on a diet! I mean seriously, fish specialties, cooked however which way with whichever sauce? Yay!

Yes, I need to come here as often as possible.
author: Alexis B.

description:
This place was a total surprise to me and my friends. I had seen it from the window of the 22 bus so many times and finally i ate there and it was awesome. 

It's a little french bistro. The menu is short and simple. 

The mussels in white wine and garlic were delish and they serve them with a big basket of fries. Really great value too for the price. 

They had scallops as one of their specials. They were perfectly cooked and with a delicious sauce reduction with basil oil. 

I recommend checking this place out if you're looking for a restaurant in the lower haight/alamo square/hayes valley. 

enjoy!
author: Philip H.

description: Wednesday night has no corkage on your wine...but also a fine international wine list ...
author: Patrick K.

description: Definitely a great place for Seafood, especially with their grilled trout. Very tasty and would recommend to my friends.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
Delicious food and good service. 
BF and I went here for dinner tonight, very pleased. 
We started with the fried calamari appetizer; perfectly fried with a nice salad to cut the fatty fryness. 
I had their fish special - Fennel crusted Mahi-Mahi, potato puree, sesame braised greens & grilled stone fruit salsa. Really soo good. The potato puree probably had a half-stick of butter, but am not eating out to lose weight. Fish was perfectly cooked, and all the flavors melded well together. 
BF had grilled salmon with the green peppercorn sauce. Really tasty. The rice that came with his dish probably had the other stick of butter. Butter, as you know, makes everything better. 
No dessert this time - they have profiteroles and pear tarts. 
We will return. Interested in checking out their prix fixe, a nice looking deal.
author: Janine L.

description:
This is one of the hidden gems in SF that I've been happy to discover. Its strait forward seafood and the times I've gone, the service was attentive and welcoming (I've gone mostly on weekdays). The menu is simple but tasty and well prepared.  The specials on the chalk board are something to look forward to if you want something more exciting.  I'm originally from Maryland and am very particular about my crab cakes... but these did not disappoint. 

Bottom line: Great for a weeknight dinner when you want no-fuss seafood at a reasonable price.
author: Sun M.

description: Chose this restaurant after attending a performance at the nearby home of the African American Shakespeare company with my daughter and was quite pleased with the meal. No issues with my daughter's request for salmon without sauce and it was a very nice piece of fish. I enjoyed all the courses of the prix fixe meal and daughter loved the homemade vanilla ice cream. Thanks for the wonderful finish to our theater outing. We will be back with Dad.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Lovely service, very strong price point for dinner from menu.

Pris fixe menu 'til 7:00PM included salad, chef's choice (salmon) and desert for $15.00.

Well prepared and tasty.

Got a bit loud when filling up but not unbearable. 

Only problem, I think they used whole milk instead of 1/2 1/2 (or better yet real cream) for their coffee service at the end of the meal.

Well done Alamo.
author: Lewis S.

description: Salad with shallots and pecans ! perfect dressing,and enough for two. Perfectly prepared mussels with pomme frites. I asked for the salad dressing as dipping sauce for them...decadent and amazing! Snapper grilled to perfection!  The wait staff was over taxed, but Julia was calm as a cucumber in dealing with the many patrons  waiting to be seated. She was welcoming, sincere, and made our dinner simply wonderful !
author: Felecia F.

description:
Unbelievable service! Showed up 40 minutes early for our reservation (it was cold, we had nowhere to go!) but were still seated graciously despite the small size of the restaurant. I like the vibe - casual, small tables, homey. 

Ordered the steamed mussels to start and then sauteed snapper with beurre blanc sauce. Excellent fish, tender veggies on the side. No complaints here!
author: Madeline N.

description:
This review is long overdue but still timely due to all the comments about service as our story is sadly consistent.  The place was nearly empty on arrival and we were sat next to an older woman who was eating on her own.  It took a painfully long time to get water and drinks so we almost walked out but the waiter came over to apologize and took our order.  After that, we were basically stuck because it was then that a bimbo with long blonde hair walked in with her date and was greeted like a long-lost friend of not only the waiter but also the chef.  Not only were they immediately served but they had their entrees before we even got our appetizer which we had to ask about.

That explains while some reviewers experienced great service for their visit because they had one or more people in their party who was attractive enough to get the wait people or the chef to openly flirt with them while everyone else is brutally ignored.  During the long wait for everything, we struck up a conversation with the woman next to us who had already been there for over an hour and had just received her entrée.  She said the food was good and probably worth the wait but my buddy chimed in that "anger is the worst sauce" which provided the only moment of humor during that painful experience.  After getting cold, mediocre entrees and watching the bimbo and date leave satiated and with sweet farewells from the staff, we basically had to wrestle for our check.  Leaving no tip was our only recourse for a very insulting experience that ruined our evening.  The arrogance of the owner and staff is just breathtaking.
author: Klek G.

description:
Absolutely terrible. 

My girlfriend and I wanted to try something elegant in celebration of our extended ''vacation''.

When we first entered, we were greeted hastily with two menus shoved into our hands. He assured us that he would be getting to us, which lead us to believe that he would be seating us. What he actually did was bark "Are you ladies going to sit?" After we have been standing for nearly 15 minutes. After he insisted that we chose to sit anywhere available, we chose to sit at a 2 seat table with another table closely nestled next to it. The waiter shot a look and inquired if we were expecting anyone else. After we had answered no, he grabbed the two napkins/utensils in irritation. Now, from the reviews and news paper clippings decorated in the front window, I honestly had the mind set that this rather pricey menu was starring a fine dining restaurant. The ambiance sure did trick me.

After deciding what we had wanted, the waiter came along. She ordered calamari, I had ordered the sautéed fish. Now, keep in mind that I''ve never been to this restaurant and since it was obviously famous for whatever reason, I asked him to make a suggestion on what to order. I asked him what was more of the restaurant's specialty and he literally barked at me over and over. 

rude waiter: "what would you like?"
me: "I don't know, what is more popular here? What is the special? I was thinking I would order the sauteed fish special."
rude waiter "which fish would you like?"
me: "I'm not sure.. I'm not a picky eater and I don't know where to start here. I've never eaten here..what's the most popular? what do you prefer?"
rude waiter: "what, kind of fish, would you like."
friend: "okay, what kind of fishes do you serve?"
- I decide on the tuna.
rude waiter: "now how would you like it cooked?"
me: "sauteed" (LIKE I HAD MENTIONED THE FIRST TIME.)

He made no eye contact with me.

My friend swooped in, saving me from his rude-helpless-serving stuck-up attitude. My friend and I were appalled, we came in with the intention to enjoy a few drinks and an extravagant dinner and got krap service with mediocre food. Not only was that terrible but the contrast of the service between our table and the one across us was an absolute smack in the face.

He had seriously not only spoken to them in a much welcoming and warmer tone to the other table across from us, but also had called a cab for them as well.  I'm feeling that he treated us the way he did because my girlfriend and I were younger and weren't a couple. Well let me tell you, we would not be dining at a restaurant that we could not afford, if not splurge. This is one of the most awful experiences I'd ever had. I'm just happy to know that I wasn't a tourist going in there, I'd probably have the wrong impression of the whole entire city. 


food: 3 1/2 - 4 stars
wine: 4 1/2 stars
decor: 4 stars
service: negative stars
author: Leelee E.

description:
Go for the fish cooked one of four ways and prepared with one of five sauces.  On weds. BYOW makes it so all you pay for is a delicious appetizer and your meal.  Portions are perfect.  I had rainbow trout blackened with buerre blanc which was stupendous.  My lady had snapper as did our friend and they both loved their meal.  Also, steamed mussels come with a really flavorful broth and pommes frites.  This equals dipping-ambrosia once the mussels are gone.  So good I wouldv'e just eaten a bunch of that broth with bread and been happy.
I left feeling very satisfied.  We found parking a block away as this is the easier side of Alamo square to find a spot.  Also, I didn't really experience service issues but then again there were only three of us.
author: tim b.

description: This place is great! Being from out of town we were looking for a good restaurant for dinner that was not a ridiculously priced tourist-trap with bad food. This is a small, intimate bistro type restaurant (not a chowder or fish house). Though most of the menu is comprised of fish dishes. Very reasonably priced about 4 fish selections around $16, your choice of preparation served with vegetables & a starch. The service was friendly & we enjoyed the bread & fresh herb/olive oil they brought with it. We had a couple of well behaved kids with us & it didn't seem to phase anyone. I had the ribeye with arugula & pommes frites, it was delicious.  There are other items on the menu as well as several daily specials. The restaurant is located in a residential neighborhood on a hill, we found street parking up the street and around the corner.
author: Jnet M.

description: It is with great sadness that I write this review. My husband and I have been loyal fans of this place for many years traveling from the East Bay about every three months to dine at this local gem. We often bring friends, introducing them to this special place BUT last night was an utter disappointment that left us a tad embarrassed of the hype we shared with our guests. The place was absolutely packed and with only 2 wait staff and one who only had been on the job 4 days... things did not go well. Our waiter was very pleasant so no fault of his but just too many diners with too few staff. First after 30 minutes of having been sat at our table we had to ask for bread. A number of times we had to request our water glasses be refilled and our salads were forgotten and after mentioning upon receiving our entrees. He brought the salads but our was soaked with dressing with too few of the toppings, it was not good at all... the entrée portion was so skimpy and the mashed potatoes was portioned as if it were being rationed. Last night's experience was so unlike all our past dining experiences it makes me wonder if Andre sold the place. I gather my husband and I will go back (alone...without friends) one more time to make sure things have not changed permanently before saying farewell. Our experience in January with dear friends was a stark contrast to last night... I'm feeling the need to apologize to our friends who we introduced to ASSG yesterday evening ;-(
author: Ann W.

description: What a great spot! Perfect for a date in the neighborhood. The specials are delightful and you can't go wrong with any of their sauces. Great mussels too!
author: Grady B.

description:
I've been very remiss in my reviews of late, but I've been meaning to write this for a while now. Procrastination is a dangerous thing.

I've been eating here regularly for over a year and have never yet had a disappointing meal. The food is a mix of US and European styles, with a few regulars dishes like the hanger steak (excellent), mussels (ditto) and garlic snails (best I've had outside France).

It also has a selection of fish that can be cooked how you like it and with a choice of sauces. But if you go hold out for the daily specials. 

Some of the best food I've had since moving over here has come from the specials board. The lobster pot pie was so good my stomach wanted to take me home and cuddle me all night for being so good to it, the risottos are superb, the lamb shank so tender it fell off the bone and melted in the mouth and the French onion soup is, quite frankly, exquisite.

I'd knock off half a star for the bouillabaisse, which seemed a bit thin when I had it and lacked the rich, dark texture of other versions but this may be a US thing.

I've seen some complaints about the length of time it takes to get served. There's two reasons for this as far as I can see. Firstly, they cook their food properly. Oven cooked takes time and that is reflected in the taste; too many restaurants just slap stuff in the microwave which can destroy some delicate flavours and overheat certain foodstuffs.

Secondly the place can get very busy indeed, particularly on Wednesdays, and that too cuts down on the service time. But enjoy the wait, dip your bread into the delicious herby olive oil that comes to everyone and savour the taste.

The wine list is good, if somewhat limited but you'd expect that from somewhere this small and the quality is high. They do a nice line in cognac as well.

I'm moving to the East Bay soon and will have to curtail my visits to this little gem, but it's got under my skin and I know I'll be back.
author: Iain T.

description: i love this neighborhood restaurant! The service was great, and the ambiance was even better. The food was also very yummy. We had the Prixe Fix, which was very reasonably priced ($14.50 for three courses). The salmon was perfectly cooked; so yummy. The portions were perfect: not enough to take home leftovers, but I felt full and satisfied at the end.
author: Emily D.

description:
I've been here with my daughter a half dozen times.  Food is great, prices are a real value and the atmosphere is perfect.  My complaint is that the service is hit or miss....first time there, super slow.  Second time there, forgot the appetizer.  Third time there, ordered dessert ....and waited and waited and waited.  Finally said something and the said, oh forgot.  Like many of the non-5 reviews, it isn't about the mistakes, it is about the American custom of apologizing graciously, vs apologizing with the attitude of well, a french waiter!  Maybe this is all on purpose and part of the charm and easier than having dogs sit at the tables.

Serious feedback to the owner(s) -- an attitude of gratitude for all the people that love what you do -- but pay attention to your team being courteous to your customers.  Mistakes do happen, and people forgive if you let them.
author: Mark P.

description:
This cute neighborhood restaraunt is amazingly deliscious!
I had the blackened trout, my friend had the grilled salmon.  Both dishes were beyond our expectation!  The staff was very friendly as well.  Can't wait to go back to our neighborhood gem.
author: E M.

description:
3.5 stars.

Awesomely cheap place to get yummy fish with delicious sauce!  I got sauteed salmon with the lemon/butter/herb/wine sauce, and it tasted great with the rice.

Knocking of 1.5 stars for the disgusting frozen veggies - just don't serve them!  Or better yet, cook some fresh asparagus or any other cheap fresh vegetable and give a small portion of it on the plate.  Point is, it left a bad taste in my mouth (literally).

This place is super casual, and service is slow but waitress was nice and polite.

The green sauce they serve with the bread is AMAZING.  I think its just fresh made pesto diluted with tasty oil???
author: Ali G.

description: My new favorite restaurant. The food is both phenomenal and surprisingly affordable, and the wonderful Alice took really good care of my gluten-free needs - and remembered exactly what I had eaten the last time I was there! Now that's good service. Even my my French friend was impressed by the food, which is high praise indeed.
author: Djinn G.

description:
If your in the mood for french food, Alamo Square is your place.

During my visit I enjoyed their Steamed Mussels as an appetizer and their Pan roasted supreme chicken breast as my entree. The sauce from the mussels is a great dipping sauce for your bread, full of flavor. I guarantee you will only have the shells left in your plate. 

Great date night place! Not to casual and not to fancy. Definitely a hidden gem of San Francisco.
author: Kristina S.

description:
This is a cute French bistro with a small menu and a cozy feel. Perfect for a little family dinner. 

The fish was delicious -- I had the blackened salmon on the prix fixe menu. The vegetables and side dishes that came with the salmon were also superbly cooked. 

The salad dressing was perfect too - it was a lite vinagerette. 

I love that they serve you bread with olive oil - everything is heavy on the olive oil actually. 

The dessert was not so good, it was just a pile of eggy merigne with caramel. Some people might like that, but no one on our table. 

I thought it was fairly affordable, and when my dad asked if soup was included the snooty server gave him a hard time, but threw it in. He is a snob -- and having just returned back from Paris a few weeks ago, I was surprised because the French in France were not that way! He's giving his peeps a bad name.
author: Natalie W.

description: this is one of my favorite places in SF. Cozy place to spend a vibrant evening, enjoy some great wines and fine cuisine made by this talented and easy-to-talk-to french owner, this is the place to go for a date or with some friends! love going there! bon app! :)
author: Yannick G.

description:
Was here last night for my belated birthday dinner. Greeted by friendly staff. Did not have a reservation but they were able to seat us. Small but very inviting and warm place. 
Started with a calamari, lightly battered and tender. It was accompanied with a mixed greens and white bean salad. 
I had the Shrimp Scampi Special along with a lemon rosemary rice risotto cake and Swiss chard. The rosemary was cooked in with the rice. 
My companion had the Provencale Grill Trout served with market vegetables. 
By the end of the evening, we were both happy and satisfied with our meal. A winner in our book along with the Giants winning the first game in the series.
author: Thimathy P.

description:
Another cute little unassuming restaurant i had the pleasure of dining at.  The ambiance of Alamo Square is perfect for dinner with a group of friends or a date.  Ive been dining/drinking at a lot of places lately with dim lighting, and unlike some who dont care for it, i really like this.  Could be because im effing blind and i feel like gizmo every time i walk into a room with bright lights.  *shrugs*

I had more glasses of wine than i would have liked before we got to Alamo, so i passed on having another.  But then ended up ordering a champagne cocktail...which i didnt like, so then ordered a regular glass of champagne, which was a lot better than the cocktail.  Indecisive?  Yeah, just a little bit.

I had the salmon as my entree but cant remember if i had it poached or grilled, i think poached, in a butter sauce, and it was really good.  Im pretty sure there were veggies on the plate too.  Ok, i'll be honest, though i know my entree was really good (even when my jeans started feeling a little tight around the waist, i still kept cramming more in my mouth, thats how i know i liked it), i cant remember anything else specific about the dish.  When i got home, i barely remembered eating.  Like i said, too much wine.   I do remember having a couple bites of my friend's chocolate cake as well.  It was good, not too sweet, light, and just the right amount of chocolate goodness.

Alamo is definitely worth a repeat visit.
author: Juv C.

description:
I live in NYC and came with a couple of friend's on their recommendation. We were seated on a slow weekday evening. One server, took him a few minutes, which was fine.  He wasn't the friendliest guy, but was clearly busy since he was the only server. The food was great. My entree (I forget the exact dish, it was one of the specials and everyone at the table ordered it) was cooked perfectly. I had a cauliflower soup to start that was great as well. Very well priced with some interesting wines as well.

Service, however, well... lets just say I sent a separate email to them about that.
author: Taylor C.

description: Absolutely delicious food and the servers were prompt, nothing like the reviews I had read. There were two of them and, though the female was definitely more friendly than the male, neither were rude and I had very courteous service. And, like I said, the food was amazing. I definitely recommend this little restaurant!
author: Rachel F.

description: This is our neighborhood eatery. Its always delicious and has such a warm reception. I must say though that the service could be better since every time I am in the place there is only one person working. Other than that the seafood is always fresh, the Rib-eye is tender and the mussels with pomme frites is delish. My personal favorite is the Calamari app.
author: Bri R.

description:
I've only been here once, and that is a total shame, because I loved it.  Not only that, but it's right down the frickin' street from my house!  Some people hate on the Lower Haight/Alamo Square neighborhood, but I absolutely love living there, and this is such a cute little local gem.

It's small inside, but really warm and cozy -- although I went there with my father when he was in town, I do think it'd be a good place to go on a date.  

I agree with the Yelper that said that their special board is hard to read, but good lord, it didn't bother me that much.  And the waiter clearly knew a lot about the food and was passionate about their menu, which goes a long way with me.  Everything we had was fresh and delicious.  

I really need to go back soon to check out the Prix Fixe... $14.50?  It sounds too good to be true!  I think it's a smaller portion, but hey, that might be for the better.
author: Sarah L.

description: Whenever I want to feel I am in a real French bistro and have great fresh fish at a reasonable price I head to Alamo Square. It has a very cosy atmosphere and the staff is super friendly. I love being able to select my fish and choose the sauce and how I want it cooked. I usually go for the blackened Ahi with a green pepper sauce. The whine selection is good and the owner always has excellent recommendations. One of my top 5 favorites in San Francisco.
author: Eric K.

description: Got there for our reservation and waitstaff seemed like they didn't know what to do.  They told us to wait for a table to turn and then the changed their mind and said "Or you could just sit over there."  They just didn't know what was going on.  They brought us menus and then we didn't get another visit from a server for 25 minutes when we just got up and left.   Food looked alright, but the fish portions looked pretty small (4-5oz if I had to guess)
author: Mike P.

description:
It is hard to do simple food well. That is why I give ALAMO four stars.
They offer fresh fish, simply prepared. You choose the cooking method and the sauce. I had seared ahi with Beurre Balnc. Perfect! My mate had roasted Halibut. Devoured it before I could taste. 

Service - friendly and familar. Atmosphere - not too casual, not too fancy. Pricing - about $20 plate average. VERY San Francisco neighborhood gem-ish. 

I would definitely go again!
author: P C.

description: The service was just horrendous. The one and only waiter for the entire restaurant was rude and slow. I'll never go back. Awful awful awful.
author: Kartik H.

description:
This is a nice neighborhood spot. Food can be a little uneven -- I've had disappointing meals but also some that I would gladly eat every night for a week (corn risotto about three months ago...I still dream of you..you were wonderful). 

The service is equally uneven. Sometimes it just seems like they are inattentive. I hate sitting with an empty water glass or clean plate with knife and fork aligned as to indicate it's ready to be cleaned -- for ten minutes while they chat at the register. 

Dessert is always good, so sometimes we just go for that.
author: Emily E.

description:
Half off vines on mondays!
Good food
Nice atmosphere
author: Xavier F.

description:
Came here with a group for dinner before a show at The Fillmore.  Would have been a terrific evening; prix fixe seemed like a great value, the food was pretty good...  But the waitress spilled a full glass of wine on someone in our group! Ok. Ok.  Accidents happen and we were going to a concert, not some formal event.  But the manager didn't come over to apologize.  They didn't offer to replace the wine and STILL charged us for the wine that they spilled!  

wow... Dining out isn't just about the food.
author: Rochelle R.

description: Ate here with out-of-town guests on a whim after searching OpenTable for openings the day after Christmas. We arrived at 7:30 and were seated right away. I got the pan roasted half chicken, my guests got crab cakes and grilled mahi mahi. We got wine with dinner and coffees and a flourless chocolate cake for dessert. All of it was delicious! I was nervous about the quality of the food since the prices were so reasonable and the restaurant was not crowded, but we were all blown away by the quality and the service. They even threw in the chocolate cake for free! We all agreed we would have expected to pay much more for a dinner of that caliber. Would definitely return.
author: A C.

description: Great food,  great service, great value!   If I lived in San Francisco I would probably eat here every night.  The prix fixe menu is terrific, but so is everything else.  This is a nice quiet relaxing restaurant where you are sure to get a good seafood dinner.    Absolutely the best.
author: Anonymous A.

description:
A good restaurant experience is a combination of at least good food and good service.  The food here was good (not great) but the service here stank!

Seven of us had dinner here on May 14 and experienced the worst service ever.  The waiter/server took our orders and that's all he did.

It took almost an hour for the food to arrive at the table, with no excuse or explanation offered for the delay.  What was interesting and also concerning, was the fact that the group seated adjoining us arrived later than us and had their food served earlier. 

Our food was served by a bus boy - not in itself a problem, except that the other tables were served by regular servers.  We found the food to be good but nothing special.  The mussels, however, were excellent.  I had  the Rib-eye steak, as did three others and the rest ordered fish items.  Our steaks  were well seasoned and perfectly cooked, though the steaks were a tad on the thin side.

After we had finished dinner, our plates sat for about 1/2 hr, before a different server came by to clear the table and offer dessert.  Having gone through the delays and the indifference we experienced, we opted not to order dessert.

It was very unfortunate and, I am sure, embarassing to him, that our host was forced to get up several times to check on the delay with the food, to request water, to request that the plates be cleared, etc., etc.

Considering the small size of the restaurant, our servers could not have helped but notice that our table was not getting the attention it should have received.  But, nobody seemed to care.

If you do not care about service and are only looking for good food, go for it.  As for me, this was the first and last time I'll step inside this restaurant.
author: critic c.

description: AMAZING seafood. The service was great, the food was amazing. I've been living in SF for 6 months and this is, without a doubt, the best meal I've had. The place has a great atmosphere as well as super friendly staff. I will for sure be taking everyone who comes to visit to this fantastic restaurant.
author: Amy S.

description:
excellent value! Contrary to many other yelpers, i thought the service was great. May have been a slow night but the server/waiter was friendly and attentive. 
My fiance and I had three appetizers - scallop ceviche, escargo and crab cakes. We loved all three, especially the crab cakes. For our mains we had sea bass and trout. The fish was less than spectacular but overall it was a great dining experience. Also, the inside is very cozy and warm.
author: brandon m.

description:
Wow :) 
Wednesday nights you can BYOB - free uncorking!!! :) 

So, this place is delicious, the prices are good, & the service is fantastic!

You've gotta get the fish - it's fresh! You get to choose the fish, the sauce, & how to cook it. The bread is great - the dipping sauce for the bread? CLUTCH. It's some sort of pesto w/ lemon/garlic/olive oil YUM :) Also, if they've got the flourless chocolate cake - get it. It's worth it. 

So yes, overall: got an appetizer, the salmon, & the chocolate flour-less cake all for under $30. YUM :)
author: linda t.

description: Went to grab a bite before the Nutcracker.  Wife and I had the salmon special; $14.50 for Xmas sake! And it was some of the best salmon we've had.  Everything was great.  Highly recommended.  We take the 22 from Marina-land and it drops us off right in front of the place.  Went back on Monday to find out it was 1/2 price wine night!  Another great meal, the mussels were awesome w/great fries; this place is really nice.  Plan on going back on a Weds for no corkage; What's not to like?
author: Bill G.

description:
food: three stars (* * *)
I had the blackened salmon.  The sauce was forgettable but the fish was cooked very well and was quite tasty.  The smattering of vegetables on the side tasted like they had been frozen and didn't impress.  The rice pilaf tasted like any instant rice pilaf you would buy from a box--it satisfied, but was not extraordinary.

environment/service: two stars (* *)
ASSG has truly mastered the art of ambience with an intimate candle-lit environment that keeps it casual.  If only the service were as up to par.  There was only one waiter and one bus-girl for the entire restaurant.  There was only one chef for everyone.  It took nearly 40 minutes for our dinner to arrive, and this was with the restaurant at half-capacity.  We were also double-charged for a glass of wine and the waiter rushed to swipe our credit card before we could tell him.

value: three stars (* * *)
Overall, the restaurant is a good value, with our entrees at around $12-15 each and the dessert and wine around $7 each.

average of
food: three stars
environment/service: two stars
value: three stars
================
averaged grand total: three stars

estimated price per person (excluding drink):
$20-25

would i recommend it to others?
If you like having prompt service, no.  If that doesn't bother you, then I think it's worth it.

would i return?
Possibly.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
I was disappointed that we weren't informed that the prix-fixe menu applied to groups of 6 or less until we got to the restaurant; the attractive prix-fixe was the whole reason I chose it in the first place. Nonetheless, the evening was filled with mostly hits and a few misses.

I probably would have been happy dipping bread in the mussel broth the whole night. Absolutely delicious. The appetizers in general were probalby my favorite part of the entire meal.

The fish meals were hit or miss, I probably should have asked for a recommended pairing, some people got amazing stuff. But i guess that's my own fault for not asking. 

While others at the table didn't, I really liked my dessert, the lfoating island - totally unfamiliar with it and hadn't seen it elsewhere.

It was also great that they were able to accomodate a big group.

Reasonably priced wine too.
author: Mark A.

description: Delicious fish, french deserts and perfect ambience, whats not to like
author: Jade H.

description: Value value value. Rock bottom prices on solid French seafood.
author: Roger H.

description:
This place was really a pleasant surprise!  A small neighborhood restaurant that has a very simple and very affordable menu of fresh seafood.  

Had a fried oyster appetizer special which amazing!  The oysters were large, perfectly fried and tasted very very fresh.  

For dinner I had blackened red snapper and my fiance had grilled salmon.  Came with perfectly cooked rice and sauteed veggies.  We were very impressed with the quality of the food for how affordable the prices are here!  

The only downside was the service.  There were only two people working and the service was very very slow.  Not sure if they were just under staffed that or what but hopefully it is not like this every time.  

Will definitely be trying this place again.
author: Dan L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place and the girls and I were very excited to give it a try. 
It's cute and we have friends that live in the neighborhood. 
But I cannot in good faith award any more than 2 stars. 
Unfortunately the sheer lack of tact and below standard of care handling by the waitstaff made this THE WORST DINING EXPERIENCE OF THE YEAR.

The ladies and I go out as a group at least once a month and have  frequented all types of  new and exciting and old-standby restaurants in the city, from low to high end. I decided on Alamo Square Seafood Grill because of the rave reviews of fresh fish, the convenient location, and the early prix fixe option. I made a reservation through open table 2 weeks ahead, and even sent an email to the owner to ask about corkage options for a large party(6). This was our last diner together for 2008, and we were exchanging holiday gifts. We wanted a cozy low-key place. Yelp to the rescue as always, this place fit all our criteria.

Everyone in the party arrived within 20minutes of the scheduled reservation,
then the wait began. We waited:
for bread
for the waitress to tell of any specials(a few were on the board)
for the waitress to answer any questions about the fish offering for the 
evening for those that would be ordering the prix fixe.
for our first bottle to be uncorked.

Not only did we wait, but we HAD TO ASK(!!?) 
for each of the items listed above.

We actually felt as if the table was overlooked on purpose.
Who in the hell waits 30minutes before bread is brought to the table when the entire party is seated? At least two of the dishes had to be sent back because they were cold, and one of the dishes was completely wrong. The main entrees were all very good, but the starters and desserts offered at Alamo Square Seafood Grill are nothing spectacular.

The icing on this slice of crapload cake was that we were overcharged by about $150.00 when the bill arrived. We have had 350.00 dinners, when it comes to food and wine we don't play around. This experience in no way came close to something of that caliber and we immediately knew hat something was off. It was blatantly obvious! The waitress clearly saw that there was an issue but made no move to come over and ask if there was a problem. We  just sat around looking foolish punching numbers into 3 different iphones and scratching our heads like 'what the hell is going on'. We again HAD TO ASK for the dinner menu, the dessert menu, and finally for her to come over and itemize the bill. She quickly checked off a few things, what they were and turned around and left. 

Thankfully one of the girls in the crew is an accountant. She went through the bill a final time and simply stated: "The math is off, this doesn't add up." We again called the waitress over and this time she returned with the half-assed excuse: 
"something must have been left over on the register." After a slow build up to boiling point over the evening  I was completely livid. After an insincere apology from the waitress-she did not look anyone at the table in the eye-we left never to return again. I felt completely horrible and apologized to all the girls, what a sad way to remember our last night together.  I won't get to see a few of them until our dinners start up again in the new year :(

If you do visit,  make sure to review the bill with an eagle eye. I wonder how many patrons have just slipped their cards in the little black book without even reviewing the charges? If it happened to us I'm sure that they have overcharged others before. And to the waitstaff, if you don't enjoy interacting with the public don't choose a customer service oriented job. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
Pretty Good, but not excellent.
Escargot-Pesto Sauce overpowered taste
French Onion soup-Really Good
Trout Grilled with marinara sauce-pretty good
Red Snapper Blackened with marinara sauce-pretty good
No Corkage on Weds-Nice
Romantic Ambiance, reasonable prices
Service hit and miss depending on how busy. Pretty small place.
author: M B.

description:
To: Douchey Staff
From: A polite customer who knows that food service jobs are hard.
Re: Why I tipped two cents for only the second time in my life.

1)  Upon checking in ten minutes early for my reservation, you coldly told me "I know; wait outside," and seated me 30 minutes late.

2)  The waiter responded rudely to a simple question about a menu item.

3)  I asked the waiter three times to change my water glass because it had a bug in it, to no avail.

It is not worth demeaning myself for your mediocre food and constipated service.  I worry a little that you'll get an aneuryism while trying to defecate.  In the "plus" column, if you die, this would be a good location for a place with better service.
author: Steve K.

description:
Let me preface by saying I have only eaten here once, but needless to say, I'll definitely be back.

Boy and I went for dinner Saturday night.  It was a fairly quiet night and service was leisurely, but I didn't mind.  We started with a sample of some sort of corn and cheddar chowder which was delicious.  Next, we had some shrimp and haricot vert risotto and a scallop and mushroom gratin.  Both were excellent.  Then the boy had the salmon and I had some salad special.  Again, delicious.  Finally, we ended with the tiramisu.  Yummy, yummy, yummy.

We both ordered the house wines (cab and chardonnay)...next time I'd go with a bottle.  The house wines were just mediocre.  Get a corner seat if you can...much more quaint.

All in all, it was a very satisfying meal for under $80 (and that's with 6 glasses on wine on the bill).  It's in walking distance so we will definitely be back!

Update 2/14/07:
I'm changing my tune...4 stars + 2 stars / 2= 3 stars on average.

Went here for Valentine's Day on a Wednesday (FYI...on Wednesdays they don't charge a corkage fee).  So, I decided to splurge on some decent wine to bring.  Turns out there was a prix fixe menu...only option.  $40 a person for 5 courses so not too expensive and actually quite delicious.  They failed to mention this to anyone before they were seated though so some people ended up walking out.  Service was awful...the couple next to us went through 3 courses before a server even spoke to them...and that was only because they skipped serving them a course.  Still, the meal was very satisfying...especially the seared salmon with crab risotto and blood orange.

So the bill comes...guess what?  They charged us a corkage fee.  Thanks guys!  Thanks a lot.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Thanks to Chef Lance and Todd for making a memorable birthday dinner for my roomate Carly.  They were totally accomodating and understanding when our reservation went from 15 to 9.  They also dealt with us in our silly hats and party favors.  We got the royal treatment because we know Lance from the Blue Jay Cafe, so he hooked us up.  That however is not why they are getting 5 stars.
